j3Wgxv2LfPlkzockEA_glg.text: OK fish and pasta at really high prices.  I started with the langoustines which tasted like a charcoal grill and were a bit chewy.  Then I had the warm cheese custard with mushrooms which I found odd and not very flavorful.  I tasted a pasta with the $90 extra truffles on them was disappointing. I've had good truffles, and these lacked flavor entirely.  The fish we had was good, cooked well, and served with a nice olive tomato sauce.  Our service was poor; the waiter brushed me off when I ordered a second drink, saying he'd be back, and he never returned, so we had to flag him down a second time.  We skipped dessert because the meal took so long.  Overall, I was really disappointed with the food.

gRPPDQmeDpW_YKdDtpxroA.text: My second best in Vegas after Guy Savoy but not after last 3 nights in a row   Cooking execution just average  New pasta dish en cartochio at $92 for regular portion has good ingredients but does not taste super  is chef tasting it coming out of the kitchen? I doubt it  great quality seafood but does not taste great  Returned 2 tagliatelle with porcini due to too much salt and I like salt  Wine service on first night for 2nd bottle took too long to get service   Front desk staff and others cordial but just not attentive enough   Langoustine not available 2nd night   Sold out  Negroni on first 2 nights excellent but just ok tonight  Will think twice before coming again  Why ? Have no answer  Told Manager Warren Richards. Wanted no credit paid for all  Help Mr Wynn and Mr Bartollata

YQMmPvsBxty2qvaRQvjHIA.text: SUPERB service, xlnt food, great atmosphere.  Pasta was perfect al dente. Somm offered a perfect pairing and didn't try to oversell.  DEF REC!!

Mn5CHTHcWPaq9cY02OkyHg.text: Completely average, forgettable seafood at an astoundingly elevated price. With so many great places in Las Vegas to choose from, this restaurant is just not worth it. This restaurant falls far short of the Wynn's otherwise excellent standards.

DVP17rymwtQ7uFn9SnqUvA.text: The Top Chef Tasting Menu is a must!!! Make sure you come hungry because it looks like four courses on the menu, but it is really 12 courses. Amazingly fresh fish flown in almost daily!! You even get to select your fish from a special tank the server wheels table side. House-made pasta!! Daily-spun gelato/sorbets!! Fantastic dinner!!! We'll be coming back here for sure.

r6kChEcmMr3H8zNUhEvHuA.text: How many restaurants can boast a menu that imports fresh, LIVE fish and crustaceans from the Mediterranean every other day???  Yep, Bartolotta can! They brought us a cart with all the live seafood options for us to preview.  We chose the purple snapper (never even heard of that before) that was delicious!!  They filet the fish in front of you.  We ordered two amazing appetizer pasta portions and a half bottle of wine.  Everything was amazing! Must try the olive oil cake dessert - yum!  On the way out, a nicely dressed gentleman got up from his table to ask us how our meal was and introduced himself as Mr. Bartolotta, the owner!  We were so tickled, we asked to take a picture with him.  What a wonderful, one-of-a-kind dining experience!

8NKm9DagLtc-7vs6sRzX1A.text: This is and has been for some time now the best (most affordable of the best) restaurant in Las Vegas. Tip, EAT AT THE BAR! JP and Rich are as good as it gets and so is the food. Make your next trip to Vegas a great one and stop in. Split all the pasta apps among four guests and leave very happy.

n4vnGqJjEm4_5ZYeLvD94g.text: My family came here for dinner last night.  While we weren't dressed to the nines, we were dressed nice enough.  When giving our name to the person at the entrance, he said three times, and without even making eye contact with my husband, who is 6'6" and African American, that it was nice to have him with them, which I thought very odd.  That's okay though because we run into racial profiling off and on so I was just going to let it go.  We were led down the staircase into the dining room where we were seated at a big round table for four (we had three) and basically forgotten about after our waters were brought and the fish specialist did his routine and described all of the fish they had available.  It took so long for anyone to come by to take our order that I actually had to ask one gentleman if we could get some service.  All in, dinner was $180 before tipping and service was mediocre at best.  Would not recommend or return.

d6aNoT_5HTm5W8RNlHbhOQ.text: I give this place 4 stars.  The service was definitely excellent and the restaurant definitely has a great ambiance and looks great!  I highly suggest their shrimp wrapped in bacon and crab cake appetizers.  The shrimps are a large size and are delicious.  I also really liked their octopus appetizer mixed with broccolini.  This is definitely a great restaurant for seafood.  One dish I did not like was their risotto frutti di mare was the dish that lost them the 5 stars.  This is a horrible dish.  The risotto was undercooked and was hard to chew and there were hardly any pieces of seafood, like three tiny pieces, seriously?   The main dish of Seabass was excellent.  I really enjoyed this dish.  The fish was cooked to perfection it was flaky in the sauce was excellent and so were the vegetables.  I enjoyed Costa Di Mare.  Overall a fine restaurant.

PBo3VhSAKb18IV3xKEKZFw.text: Went here with high expectations. Left incredibly dissatisfied. Went in last night (Friday) and day at the bar, service was terrible, food was equally bad.

BDUPFSFE7T70jyPGHsGodg.text: I have dined here 3 times as well as done the Wynn Master Class. The first time was at Christmas, then two times since. The food here is good, I actually wish I could use half stars because this place would get 3.5 from me. The seafood here is very good, and the pasta is delicious, I highly recommend trying the squid ink pasta, clams, and ordering one of their big fishes to share. We always do a salt crust one and no matter what we pick it is good! After seeing how they make the salt crust it makes me want to get it even more! The reason I didn't give them five stars is because for the Wynn, the service here is sub par. I regularly dine at SW, Wing Lei, and Tableau, and I never receive the slow service that I receive at Costa di Mare. Especially on our most recent visit on 7/18. Service started out decently, however my drink was forgotten and I had to reorder twice, but as the meal went on it began to get harder and harder to get a servers attention. It seemed like there were only two servers in the entire restaurant. The Bussers kept up well but after finally getting my initial beverage, a Bellini, I was not asked if I would like another. We finally got our dinner, saw our server, but I believe that was the last time we saw him. We also made it clear when ordering that three of us were sharing appetizers, pasta, etc, but were continuously only brought 2 share plates for each course. We waited almost 30 minutes between the time our dinner plates were cleared for us to order dessert. I usually love the Wynn for their standard of service and I definitely felt the fell short with this restaurant. That or they need to hire more servers. Overall, I will visit again because I love the food, but I will definitely pick SW or Wing Lei over this restaurant any day.

-ZxpKhhqJm3_mvlE_kAj1w.text: Let's talk about the room first.  It's pretty, depending on where you sit can be romantic.  We are downstairs in the main dining room but could see upstairs placed near the big staircase.  This will be a pricey meal.  We didn't order much it was several hundred dollars.  The fish is by pound by you can't exactly request say a 1.5 lb fish.  It just depends on what they have.  You can say a smaller or bigger fish from what you have.  Personal opinion here.... for what you pay I was slightly under impressed and will likely not revisit.  With that said its seafood and the Wynn and you should expect it to be pricey.  Everything was good and I have no complaints about quality.  If I could I'd give 3.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7tS5ZhN6fK7t31ApNik0fg.text: One of my worst experiences ever in Las Vegas and fine fine - period!  Definitely some pay to play at  host stand.  We requested upstairs and got seated downstairs at worst spot in place.  They moved us because I explained it was my birthday.  The staff was not attentive in fact they just didn't service the table.  I had no water,  no drink and no follow up upon meal presentation.  I absolutely got taken on the lobster.  I paid for a pound and didn't come close to getting it.  I have experience with food weight so I'm not guessing here.  If it was free and they gave me he best table I would not go back.  We are not complainers and are well travel and sophisticated adequately to be fair about a review.

drTVijBz7yowj1Hk3QjFtw.text: We are locals and ate at Costa Di Mare last night.  We were very disappointed with the food as the fish dishes were small, no flavor and very expensive.  The shrimp appetizers had no shrimp meat in them as it was basically a whole shrimp ( very small) and was all shell.  We had the fried fish appetizer pieces and again it was a lot of bones, very small pieces and pricey for what you got.  The pasta we ordered was the best part of the dinner but the whole fish was bland and not good.  This is a bummer for us and the ratings on this restaurant were 5 stars.

Rupz9XtdbkYbLad-vQXGZA.text: We went to Costa di Mare for my best friend's birthday celebration and it was AMAZING! They were able to seat us outside in the cabanas. We had the tasting menu and everything was so delicious. 10/10 would come back with more people.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sJTP9oB_bckM4NpvComFeA.text: As a Las Vegas Local and Vegan, I was so impressed with the drinks, food, service and ambiance of this establishment. We didn't have a reservation but were able to get a table within a half hour on a busy Saturday night. We waited at the bar where I asked for a fun mocktail as I am pregnant. Our bartender muddled fresh berries and added exotic juices to create a wonderful tropical virgin drink.  When we got to the table we were delighted to have a spectacular view of the outdoor patio area and we're greeted promptly by our Server Declan, who never missed a step. He made fabulous Vegan recommendations for us, and we were even brought Vegan bread and butter, and a vegan Amuse Bouche. The staff kept our glasses full, our table bussed, and were very accommodating. We also enjoyed the Vegan chocolate cake for dessert. This was a real treat for us to have a night out with a True culinary experience. We will definitely be back.

F4ik2NLJUyKe50fGePehhQ.text: Love the decor, location, the food was very excellent and the manager was very helpful because at first we had a miscommunication with the staff.  He was able to assist us and made us feel welcome.

YziKIYxcDWtKHGsYetEHow.text: Food and service is amazing. But beware of the price!  Prob not a place for a family. Good for a date or something like that. When I seen the menu at a glance, I seen dishes for $18 and $19, so I thought let's do this. Turns out that was the price of each appetizer for each dish. And the appetizers were small portions. You would need at least two to get full. I must say though that the spaghetti fruti de mari was the best I've had in my life!  If I went again, I'd simply get two portions of that and keep dinner for myself at approx $45.

b5C5l6gNZjp09yv5locwew.text: Let me say this first, don't go for the family style tasting menu, it's not worth your money or your stomach space, trust me!  Nice view from the cabana but unless you make an early reservation they ask for a minimum of $150 spend to secure one.  Nice service, like any other upscale restaurants. Nice bread, i liked the olive twist. However the server never asked me for a second, but he did with the couple right next to me, maybe he was trying to help me from a carb crisis.  The langoustine was fresh and well grilled, but they didn't have anything larger than the extra large size, so a little disappointed.  I made the mistake of going for the family style tasting menu, which has 4 appetizers, 4 pastas, 1 main fish course and desserts. I must say they're all mediocre. Not only did they look cheap they also did not have great flavors. Some were salty some were bland. A cheap italian restaurant could do the same or even better. However they did give out a lot of food.  The bomboloni (italian donuts) were yummy and they gave extra sweet treats after that and a little bag to take home too.  In hindsight I would just order a few langoustines and be done with it.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sole with sautéed spinach
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomboloni (italian donuts) and ice cream and sorbet
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomboloni (italian donuts)

iW3NOgO8M0R_Cwik16FVNQ.text: Hands down one of my favorite restaurants at the Wynn. The name changed recently but everything on the menu remains the same. Definitely give it a try!  Atmosphere I have sat both outside and inside, and I would say definitely the atmosphere outside is mind-blowing. Very romantic and serene. Just note that outside seating is not available during the winter.  Service Not much to say about the service because everything is top-notch here. The servers will always check on you periodically and recommend you drinks and food! I love it when they push the seafood cart to you and show you their specials!   Food The langoustines and grilled shrimp are great starters. The seafood is so sweet and fresh! Every bite leaves me wanting more. I also love the clam drenched in tomato sauce as an appetizer. However, my FAVORITE dish here is the rock lobster pasta. It is hands down my favorite pasta in the entire world and this is after visiting Italy for a month! The pasta comes in appetizer portions and also entree portions. It has a few pieces of lobster and the flavor is so creamy and fresh. I really can't describe how good it is and you just have to try it out for yourself! I also got the grilled fish before which is one of their specialties. It tastes exactly like how I had it in Cinque Terre of Italy so I know it is legit. However, I think the fish is a little too bland for me and nothing too special.  Price The price could be a little steep depending on what you get. You get what you pay for and this is seafood flown in from Italy! For a nice dinner for two people, I would say it costs around $200.   Overall, I highly recommend this place!

mND_hLasCweRNNYKDSj9hA.text: I found service to be very friendly, but extremely slow. My husband and I chose Costa di Mare on our last night in Vegas, partially because the menu sounded lovely, and partially because it was in our hotel and we were tired. Well, the food was OK, and we left dinner exhausted... it felt like we were there forever! To the point where we asked them to box our last course to take with us.   We both chose the tasting menu as the cuttlefish with black ink, soft polenta, pine nuts; and the grilled octopus caught our attention right away.   I ended up liking the langoustine, the best and the pappardelle, although wasn't the most pleasant looking of the plates was also very good. Everything else IMO was under-seasoned and just kind of there.   I think if you have time, this is a good restaurant to really meander along your meal, but when it's just two people, 2.5+ hours for dinner is just too much.

-rErPq_hNV5SKZfSFYHQLQ.text: This was the best Italian restaurant that I have ever eaten at in the US. The impeccable setting, high standard of service, and outstanding food were over the top. Our group of 14 required a separate room, but it was perfect. We chose the Family-Style Seafood Feast. Not for the budget-minded, this was indeed a feast. I cannot say which course was more delicious, since they were all of the highest quality. The wine steward provided a great match to our meal. Luckily for me, the bill was paid for by someone else! If you eat at an Italian restaurant in Las Vegas, make sure that it is Costa di Mare - you won't regret your decision.

Oyqj01hJvEo0YHvufaAACg.text: The food overall was good, but Let's about the service. I had to ask the waiter every question at least three times before he would answer it. For instance... the fish was priced per 100 grams. I simply asked how many ounces are in 100grams... his response was that each fish would cost around $70. After asking several time how many ounces were in 100 grams, we finally looked it up on our phones. We ordered an appetizer of pasta that had truffle sauce.  The waiter told us it had truffle oil in it and not truffles. Then when we got the dish there was not scent or taste of truffle. It took us forever to flag down the waiter. We asked two other people beforehand if we had the wrong dish before he came over.  The waiter said that it was truffle reserves and it was a butter sauce. This was not how he or the menu described the food. Furthermore, the waiter would talk over me and interrupted me every time we talked. When we were asking about the truffles he decided to give us a lecture on truffles... like we didn't know what we were talking about.  I picked this restaurant because I had heard good things and I wanted a nice meal for my wife and my last night in Vegas. It was a total disaster. The waiter never checked on us and we needed to grab other staff to get him. I could go on and on about the service but I think you get the point. We obviously had a problem but a manager never came over.  We felt uncomfortable by the end of our meal and will never come back to this place. Normally we get dessert but we decided to just get out of here. Do not go here, there are a lot better options out there.

DmaLUIjmZIdqe_aT9_Sy_A.text: Absolutely beautiful... absolutely mouth watering delicious! One of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to! We opted for the tasting menu (160) and added the grigliata shellfish trio (30) which was amazing!Definitely reserve the cabanas outside. Completely different dining experience! I was most impressed with the service. Our waiter and chef were able to alter one of the menus to accommodate my son, as he has fish allergies. It's a must if you are staying at the Wynn and/or visiting Vegas!

QLzqyyhCmxLunXyIAJZrNQ.text: All the way around was amazing! Almost cried tears of joy while eating this food. Service was the best.

Nytbu7brvovx-gRgSi8KvQ.text: Been here a handful of times over the years since the restaurant was known as Bartolatta. Really nice setting especially if you get a seat outdoors around the lake.  However, the past few times I've been, the food has taken a turn. Its still decent, just not what you'd expect at this price point or for this property.   The tasting menu seems to have swapped quantity for quality.  Everything was sort of bland and forgettable... no dish stood out in my memory after the meal, but I do recall feeling over stuffed.  The menu needs a reboot... the freshly flown fish and fine ingredients are great, but the dishes just don't live up to the potential of the concept.

bVyV1SLEIruty3rw-BBD4g.text: We came here for our anniversary. The server gave us the full speech about the fresh seafood that can be purchased by the ounce. After that, the quality of service kind of fell off. The drinks we ordered didn't come and we had to remind the server. He didn't really check back on us during the meal. It's not like the restaurant was busy. He was just chit chatting with another server.   On the other hand, the food was amazing! The seared filet was perfectly cooked. The goat cheese ravioli was the most delicious and savory ravioli I have ever had. It comes in an appetizer size but is available as an entree. I would definitely get it as an entree. The same can be said for the seafood risotto. That would be great as a full entree too. The risotto was cooked perfectly and was full of flavor and bits of seafood.  We were too stuffed for dessert but what? No "Happy Anniversary" mini dessert like other fine restaurants give you?

CASZpq8nFYxLEvQqYY0QBg.text: I went on a special date to Costa de Mare last night with my husband. We are locals and we're very disappointed.We did the tasting menu, the pasta was cold and very average.  The appetizer mussels were good. And the fish at the end was good but had fairly large bones in it. The deserts were ok but none of this food was worth the price. The ambiance would have been better if we were not staring at another couple the whole time . Our table was in front of another table looking out into the water but also blocking the view. We had made reservations so I'm not sure why we got stuck with a bad table. All in all I, don't eat here maybe just have a drink at the bar and enjoy the views.

g0jhWMwJr7q5C45eyFWVWg.text: What a charming find this was on our last trip to Vegas. It's one of the most beautiful ambiances you can get, not just on the strip but pretty much anywhere. The food was amazing and the service impeccable. Vegas is a town that overall does hospitality right in my book. The Wynn and their restaurants go above and beyond and it is one of the reasons my husband and I continue to go back. This restaurant has it all.

0oq0gvJP2sjy8aaMokzRAA.text: Our hungry party of 6, looking to be wined and dined Vegas style, were thrilled at being able to get a late night reservation via our bartender at Parasol Down in the Wynn.  What started out well, ended with two words....very disappointing.   The single biggest problem was that it took way too long to get everyone's food. Two of us opted to splurge and go for the ultimate dining experience ordering the special Top Chef menu selections.  You would expect the Bravo Top Chef Menu @ $175 per person to blow us away right?  I wanted so badly for each dish to reach the Top Chef mark and be better than anything I've had the pleasure of savoring before, but it just never took me there.    As each course was brought out, I could see the anticipation of the rest of our party, but because it was portioned for 2 we could not share the wealth so to speak.  Instead everyone else got filled up on bread and drinks by the time their entrees were served. We'd been promised "gifts of the Mediterranean", but at the end of the night it turned out to be the longest, most expensive journey on our quest for food perfection. It did not live up to the Vegas hype.    I don't know who to blame for a lackluster and well below par Las Vegas dining experience.  Initially, there wasn't going to be any compensation for having our group of 6 wait for two plus hours for the main courses, but after speaking to the manager they comped 4 meals and only charged us for the 2 Top Chef menus.    There were too many courses to mention and only a couple of stand out dishes.  Was the food fresh? Yes. Were the dishes authentic? Yes.  However, far too few pluses and several irking moments make it highly unlikely that we would return or recommend this restaurant when there are so many other great options to choose from.

BqmPSN4PUR8m4Xihd0gC_w.text: A special meal, a lovely view, attentive and informative service.  It ALMOST made me forget the price, ha ha.  Our table's appetizers included the vegetable risotto, the cocotte (parmigiano custard), and my favorite: the rabbit.   I am very happy that we tried the aragosta spiny lobsters, who apparently had been in the Mediterranean Sea the prior day.  I particularly liked the citrus agrumi preparation.  My daughter (8) enjoyed the smaller cicala slipper lobster.   Everything was prepared wonderfully--the risotto was perfect, for example. For the lobsters, we had them shelled for us tableside, and they were each delicious.  I am not sure that I was able to detect flavor differences with local seafood from the northeast, but the preparation was great, and of course there was simply the novelty of tasting recently-in-the-Mediterranean lobsters.  All in all, a memorable night!

BKjzcpZwXeknCBPxVKVp_w.text: Probably the best Italian Mediterranean Sea food I've experienced --all fish flown in daily - I love sea bass - the waiter suggested a particular fish which was excellent -  I cannot praise the well trained staff enough

kSyE9oOF7Vtzc9cUCC92GQ.text: I love this restaurant!  Service, seafood quality, ambiance, all spot on.   Ordered the following;  - Langoustine (absolutely gorgeous...Sweet and salty). - Spaghetti all`astice (pasta was cooked perfectly, white wine sauce, fantastic). - capesante dorate con arancia, puree di finocchietto e pistacchio (divine). - saute di vongole (sweet, savory and clean tasting). - aragosta (lobster was tender, sweet and had a slight salty finish).  The service is impeccable.  Waiters were friendly, sharp, and keen.  Topping off our wine glasses was a big plus in my book.  Definitely give this place a try when you are in Las Vegas, NV.  Trust me...You won't be disappointed.

B_FQLu6J50BOWzGUeFLftw.text: In all my travels around the world, experiencing different countries and cultures (and of course the important part - all the accompanying visits to foodie spots), nowhere I've gone has come anywhere close to Bartolotta's disconnect between their staff's incredible pretentiousness and their awful service as well as mediocre food. Even I can excuse some pretentiousness if the service is impeccable and the food mind-blowing (I have been to France, after all); unfortunately, Bartolotta's staff instead chooses to show unforgivable disdain for their guests by failing on all counts.  There are simply far too many issues to list, but here are the lowlights: -- our party not being seated until half an hour after our reservation time, despite many empty tables all around the restaurant -- hostess accusing a party member of not adhering to dress code even though he was wearing a collared shirt; she backed off when we asked for a manager -- our apertif champagne bottle sitting lonely in ice bucket across the room even after repeated requests for a refill (apparently only at Bartolotta is the $250+ markup not for service) -- The sommelier insistently pitching me wines (all way above my stated price point) at the same time the waiter was going over the menu with the rest of my party - just totally rude (also note the markups here are far more than other Strip restaurants) -- rock lobster in the spaghetti dish was severely overcooked... cardinal sin! -- branzino, although properly served tableside, was done so slowly that the fish was basically room temp when we finally got it; also, there were many bones left in mine -- a busser twice trying to take my half-full glass of wine - what, do they get to chug it in the back if they pull this off?  Frankly, the food and service at a midrange local seafood chain is better - not even to speak of real high-end seafood places. Avoid this restaurant at all costs. I wouldn't even bother eating here for free. There are just too many good places in Vegas to waste your time on Bartolotta.

CFeH5_KsLBCxebTVaZ0rTA.text: Bartolotta looks and feels like it belongs in Sicily or Milan.   The waiters are top of the line in quality and service. The food was exquisite and absolutely mouth watering.. My husband and I shared the pink snapper and it could have fed 3 people. I highly recommend letting the servers pick your sauces unless you really know your fish and complimenting sauce pairings. I chose a a sauce and the waiter brought us another as a pairing with the snapper and of course he was right his choice was much better than mine. I was grateful for his input. ;)  Overall, great restaurant. Don't let me forget about the bar! The bar tender has the best Martina's in Vegas... I put back a few they were So smooth, two thumbs up!  We will definitely be returning..

oM48-KkatFyw4C5kR0W6pw.text: Amazing food and service. Outdoor location is pretty nice too. Other reviews don't appreciate it for its quality. Let me be clear, this is a fine dining restaurant. Hands down the best restaurant I went to in Vegas. Definitely will return next time I'm there.

7VPXIpiCcJv2ABPod_WVJQ.text: There are many solid Italian restaurants in Vegas, this is not one of them.  The restaurant under delivered with respect to both food and service.  Having ordered their tasting menu, the sign that things were wrong, when hot appetizers came out faintly warm at best.  There are many things I could point to that made this an unenjoyable dining experience but the risotto was the bad highlight of the evening.  I received half cooked rice grains for my risotto, when letting the waiter know, he proceeded to explain to me that it was Al Dente, and perhaps it was not to my liking.  I know Al Dente, I did not need a server to passing off uncooked rice as Al Dente.  For a close to $500 dining bill for two, your money is better spent at other establishments.

LnJ6k4RxTymxmD8OPlfJEg.text: This is one of the busiest weeks in Vegas (March madness) and this place was completely empty at 6:30pm. I mean no one. Not a single customer.  I live on the strip and have enjoyed their food in the past so I figured I'd give them a pity visit. Was about to sit down at the counter (not even the main restaurant) and drop $100 on food and drink when the host informed me I couldn't enter because I wasn't wearing a collared shirt.  Seriously? You have exactly ZERO customers in your restaurant during prime dining hours and you're turning down a regular customer because he's wearing a Nike shirt?   Scr*w that. I won't deal with that kind of pretentiousness and snobbery from a 'male hostess' at any restaurant.

qOnXx5QPA--Jr0ZfLueDGg.text: 3 1/2 stars-4 stars  Staying at the Wynn so decided to check out Bartolotta for my gf's birthday dinner. The inside was big and spacious but the outside patio seating was amazing! Pond or Lagoon in the middle with several metallic like balls it was real different and pretty in the daytime. The table sections all had draperies, just like a cabana style. Very romantic and just gives you a happy vibe. The menu has several pre fix options as well as family style and your regular menu.   _Risotto ai Frutti di Mare. An appetizer pasta dish. It was rather small but still pretty big for an appetizer. The risotto was nicely al dente and luckily it was not too rich or heavy. The scallops, shrimp, lobster, clams, cuttlefish and octopus were all listed but I did not taste all of the seafood. I wish there was some shells do you knew what fish was what because it was all just mixed in so they all just look like similar white fishes. Other than that a great starter.  _Pollo alla Riviera Ligure. Pretty presentation. The chicken was cooked nicely and juicy. The lemon herb sauce was a tad rich and pretty salty. Came with some vegetables and mushrooms that were a nice compliment to the dish since it did help with the saltiness of the sauce. Nothing too spectacular, but not bad either.  _Filetto di manzo al Sangiovese. The seared filet of beef was cooked perfectly. The filet was very juicy and a great rich texture. Not sure how I felt about the wine sauce. It was a bit strong and overpowered the steak a bit for me. Accompanied with potatoes and vegetables, a great dish to get if you love steak. _ Lobster Pasta. Don't remember the name but my gf got this dish. It was some appetizer lobster pizza in a red tomato sauce. The pasta was small and since it was an appetizer size there was maybe just one big piece of lobster. The pasta was cooked nicely al dente. The dish itself was real tasty and the sauce was light. _Panna cotta. This dessert was on the house for my gf's birthday. Not sure if it's on the menu but it was AMAZING! one of the best I've had. It was so smooth and milky and not too rich. Accompanied with berries and some other goodness it was finger licking good.   Service was great and friendly. Although the food was good I think it was pretty overpriced. There are other restaurants in Vegas for around the same amount of price and way better taste and experience.

pWJhIWarv1GnE2Do3UKb4Q.text: The setting is beautiful but the food could be better. I ordered the seafood risotto and it tasted HORRIBLE. The first bite tasted as if it was all acid. I don't know if it's because of the combination of lobster, clams, fish, etc. but it definitely could be seasoned better overall. Also, the portions are "appetizer" portions meaning they're the size of the small bread plate but the dinner portion costs double! (original: $24.50) When I received my meal, the "dinner" portion, I compared it to the small dinner plate and it looked EXACTLY like the portion of the appetizer. I was charged nearly $50 so I had to ask if my portion was a dinner. My server didn't see my original portion so he didn't know if my portion was correct. But throughout my meal, they knew I was upset with the dish because I barely touched it. The dessert was pretty good. I had the chocolate almond cake with cappuccino gelato and they gave me free chocolates and cookies to go with it. Overall, the price, portions, and food could have been better.

M0uyX5gMl6sTcgbR0vdIww.text: Absolutely, positively my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas! Lasagnette Con Ragu Di Crostacei is one of the best things I've ever eaten. The seafood is so fresh and the octopus is out of this world! With seafood this fresh, it barely needs any seasoning. For dessert, the panna cotta melts in your mouth. The manager there, Sergio, was so wonderful; and every dish he recommended was spectacular! Thanks to him, we had the best service possible and I cannot wait to go back for my next seafood craving - very soon!

TjRjiy6mJ4HMO7r8stwNYw.text: Great vegan option for Vegas fine dining.  Chickpea cakes were amazing!  Pasta was great as well too.  Too notch service and beautiful atmosphere.  High-ish prices, but definitely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom ravioli with sage (I don&#39;t remember the fancy name).  Vegan bread AND butter as well!
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chickpea cakes.  Fantastic!

-900BjTCbuVbwZSleMx30Q.text: Honestly, I'm rather disgusted by this establishment.  Oh, let me clarify. The food is edible and the decor is nice; it's every other element that overrides any miniscule inkling of a redeeming quality.   This place reeks of pretentious snobbery (do I have a nomination for Understatement of the Year award?). Every encounter with a human being at Bartolotta was pathetic. From the host, to the staff filling water, and especially to the waiter, my family and I were treated as if we were 20th class citizens while dining here. We were all dressed appropriately and aren't slobs, obviously-- however, when we didn't bite on the waiter's offer for the several-hundred dollar special of the night, his demeanor flipped a 180 and we were legitimately treated less than an ugly sweater at a thrift shop.    And, to add extreme insult to injury, the prices are more ridiculous than trying to get through rush hour on the Strip. My family and I really enjoy fine dining-- typically in Vegas-- so we were prepared for the extreme price tags that typically come with the higher-end dining. However, the cash to quality ratio here just doesn't do it. At all.   Really, this is all you need to know. Horrible service and subpar food for the price (a price that could probably feed Ethiopa until 3013). Unless you own a money tree and find joy in sitting in a restaurant basking in the ambiance of other pompous, egotistical, shallow individuals, avoid Bartolotta.

eVRXjnCvAeGydfMFUhiTTw.text: Amazing Fragolina drink with vodka and strawberries! Had this while waiting for our table to be set up outside. If you come here , sit outside!!! It's a waste if you sit indoors. The interior looks and feels like a cafeteria but the outside is magical. The service is extremely attentive. This is a very high end restaurant and expensive!!! The food was OK. The clams were delicious but very tiny. Dinner was about $350 for 3 of us and I can tell you that we filled up on bread not to order any more. Could have easily spent another $100 and $150 if we wanted dessert. I probably won't come running back here.....well maybe if it's on someone else's tab ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ae7vNGoGVQ-O9lTxf6S3DQ.text: I was here this past Saturday with my Dad and two uncles while we were on a golf trip in Vegas and I greatly enjoyed this restaurant. One of my uncles was in the mood for a good chicken parm but they didn't have it on the menu here. I asked our waiter and he went back to the kitchen to see what he could do. Five minutes later, he comes out saying they will make it specifically for our table only (because I asked). Both my uncles and Dad wound up ordering it with pasta, and I had the veal chop with roasted potatoes and fried artichokes. We were skeptical of the quality of the chicken parm before they got them because if it's not on the menu then they don't necessarily have practice in making it. But our worries were shunned when the entrees came.   A huge piece of chicken parm with big slices of cheese on top was on each of the three orders, accompanied by a side of pasta. They all loved their dishes and exclaimed that I was the savior of the night for this special request, and thanked our waiter many times for making this special order. They also each had a different kind of pasta as an appetizer and really like them. My veal chop was cooked perfectly and melted in my mouth. The sides of roasted fingerling potatoes and fried artichokes were delicious as well, I couldn't stop eating them!   Our waiter was excellent as well, he picked out a great red wine for my uncle and Dad, and was on the ball with anything we wanted. While the dinner was a bit pricey, it was worth it. We all left extremely satisfied and fueled up for a night on the town. If I ever come back to Vegas and dine here again I am going to try out one of their fish dishes because they fly all their fish directly from Italy and the total time from water to entree is 40hrs; who can beat that freshness with the distance it has to travel!

wbX0Ajti00v9Ea7H0mm6fg.text: Had a lovely dining experience, from the ambiance to the food, to the service...and oh the wine! simply divine! Definitely sit on the lovely patio because it elevates the experience...will go back next time in Vegas!

PdZ-iVwrAZgWIG9MvNtetw.text: Fabulous seafood and very attentive staff. Everything was incredibly flavorful and perfectly prepared. I would highly recommend.

drsQmmOz2WPyBeLOO0bbXA.text: Five of us had dinner here recently since we were staying at the Wynn.  While the food was enjoyable, I cannot rate this restaurant higher was due to the service which was the worst of any high-end restaurant I've ever been to.  We ordered the Gran Menu di Mare which featured an assortment of seafood, but they served us instead the Menu di Paranza, one of many service mistakes of the night.   The appetizer course consisted of small dishes of:  Ligurian octopus salad (outstanding!!  Best dish of the night); baby clams with tomato sauce (so-so); seared scallops with porcini mushrooms (outstanding); and charcoal-grilled amberjack (good).   The Menus are really a great way t try many of their offerings.  Pastas were a seafood risotto (so-so); ricotta ravioli (another outstanding dish, probably one of the best pastas I've ever had in my life); and small rigatoni with scorpion fish and egglant (so-so -- could barely see or taste the fish).  The main course was a whole roasted branzino.  I've had whole roasted fish in Greece and France and am used to paying a pretty penny for it, so was not super surpised that the a la carte price for the fish was around $100.   That said, I'm so glad I didn't order this a la carte -- while the fish was good, it didn't blow my socks off and was on the small size compared to similarly priced fish in Europe.  We went with the waiter's recommendation of sauces:   the cruda (tomatoes, arugula, olive oil) was very light and paired beautifully with the fish, but the Palermitana was too heavy for such a delicate fish and overwhelmed the branzino.  By this time we weren't served dessert yet, but our 9.30 "Le Reve" show was starting in a few minutes so we had to rush out after only a bite of the desserts.   This was very frustrating since when I made the reservation, I asked several times if the time would be okay for the show and they assured me that it was plenty of time.   Then again, the reservationist also assured me that we could sit outside by the pool, but when we arrived we were told there were no spots there.  In addition to serving my husband & I the wrong menu, the server also put in the wrong order for another member of our group.  And though we said we were in a bit of a hurry to catch the show, it took FOREVER for our food to come out.   It was also very difficult to flag down the waiter when we needed water refills and to get our check.  I would be hesitant to go back to Bartolotta for a full meal, but the octopus salad was really special and I may visit just for that and other small bites.   Just beware if you're going here pre-theatre to stick to only a couple dishes, and allow yourself plenty of time.

ketlWvFqh_dUXxBbnys_pQ.text: I cannot say enough about this incredible dining experience. Manager Sergio Torrisi provided the most enjoyable and memorable evening of exquisite Italian Seafood imaginable. From the appetizers to the desserts, everything was amazing. The "Bravo's Top Chef" dinner menu is the way to go for your first visit, you will love everything and want to go back tomorrow.  An evening we will never forget and we will tell everyone we know "you have to go, ask for Sergio and tell him Marton and Lisa sent you," Bravo!!

Ruow-uPMI1h5-sgFSuZdJQ.text: We had such a great time eating at Bartolotta on night three of our recent Vegas vacation.  We sallied up to the empty bar for an early supper, and damn if that bartender was not the best dining companion I had all weekend with the exception of Carrie and my husband. That only leaves one person out, and I leave him out because he was a little cranky pants all weekend.  Onto the food.  DH first ordered some seafood pasta to tide him over until the friends arrived. DELISH! With a very light tomato sauce and rock lobster. Lobsterlicious.  I started with the steak tartare, best I have ever had, I swear. With a lovely little frisee side salad and toasted Italian bread points. I know Bartolotta is a seafood man, but this tartare was delightful.  DH had a second pasta course, a beef course with a lovely brown gravy, I had the seafood risotto appetizer and Carrie ate  something that I cannot recall but I recall her loving it.  I started with a glass of white and moved onto red. Both times the bartender indulged me by recommending wine for me and letting me try two options before committing.  He should be Knighted. He's a prince among thieves, a man among swine, a bartender controlling the alcohol around people who like to drink.  I miss him.

LRa9eyEc93XwOYYjpfSrvw.text: YUM, YUM and more YUM.  I am really surprised reading the other reviews here.  I loved this place.  Food was fantastic and I had a hard time deciding what to order.  The tasting menus all sounded delicious, but we decided to order a la carte instead.  I loved the concept of fresh imported fish flying in from Italy daily.  The presentation of the daily selections was interesting, albeit a bit overwhelming.   I tried octopus here and actually liked it a lot (I am usually not a fan AT ALL). Amazing salt encrusted fish.  Delicious imported langoustines.  Fresh and perfectly prepared. I enjoyed every part of my meal.  Seating was cozy and service impeccable.  I will be back for sure.

IIBu8omaQYRwDoObdyfi2g.text: good ol fashioned Italian Hospitality!  Food - very good. The appetizer sized pasta dishes was the perfect size to allow only 2 of us to enjoy a variety of items family style without stuffing ourselves.  Service - Phenomenal. From Sergio at the front, to the server building our individual plates from the dishes at table side to the wine sommelier who gave great suggestions and sexy descriptions of the wines. I must also have to add that big Italian menus can often seem daunting to try to make selections; however, the suggestions were bang on. Thank you! Atmosphere - stylish + sexy decor combined with a very pleasant view of the water feature. Request a table by the water!

0fqWgvPDr0WeWczrny84Dw.text: Thanks to Juan(not sure if that's his name) and Abel for a great service. A few of my friends and I went for my birthday dinner a month ago. We sat outside even though it was a lil chilly but they provide a heater which really warms the space. The inside is nice but the outside is beautiful. I recommend this place for a special evening.

1zhVmrjK8HVdaSOOClbD-A.text: We had an excellent meal it was so good that we than recommended it to our friends and came back with a party of 6. the pasta , the greens , the sea food and fish are of high quality. wine list to ecompany was great. We had two different waiters both professional and made good suggestions.  When we arrived we were greeted by the manager who was  professional warm and made sure that we where sited outside and enjoyed the fantastic outdoor romantic ambiance.  We will be back!

5b_6ozGOIfNQKWrv9WMzaQ.text: Amazing restaurant! Seafood is flown in fresh from Italy and the langostino's were seriously incredible.

7GlL4SZDsk6QV030fedpAg.text: Let's get the something out of the way first.   I HATE VEGAS. It is pointless, vacuous and insipid. I seriously can't fathom why people go there. Once it was great value, once it was a place with some character. Now...I could really go on.  The key thing I hate about vegas is the complete facsimile of everything you experience there. Nothing is as good as the real thing. The stupid Eiffel tower, Canals, New York?! It is all faux. It is then logical that my experiences of most of the restaurants there is much the same. On paper you have the best hit rate of anywhere in the world to experience high end chefs food, they all jumped on the stupid tourist spend money bandwagon and opened spots there. Obviously there are some exceptions, my point is most of it is not as good as the real thing.  Bartolotta 4-star? Well it is tough.   The food was amazing.   To start we had the best sweet little clams, undoubtedly the best langoustine I have ever experienced (and that includes living in Italy). I also enjoyed the cuttlefish. I think someone may have ordered a salad, but whats the point of reviewing that.  They show off all the fish in a wandering cart. Tell wonderful stories on how they grew up, who they played with, how Poseidon ushered them of to be caught for your dinner.  You marvel at the fact that these animals were swimming in the Mediterranean just a few hours before hitting your plate (and try to forget your contribution to global warming by fedexing them to a hot hell hole in the middle of the desert).  We overcame our guilt and for the main fish we ordered occhiona (big eye red sea bream), san pietro (john dory) and pagello (pink snapper). These are all cooked whole, roasted simply and perfectly. The come to table whole. They are expertly deboned and presented on a platter. You then eat like an emperor. The fish was sensational (note - they have lamb and stuff on the menu but the hell you order lamb at a fish restaurant is beyond me).  So why not a 5 star?  1. The fedex thing bothers me. Save your gambling $$$ and go to the Med. You'll have a better time. 2. Its in the Wynn, so the decor is hideous. It is like one of the housewife shows, like money puked-up furnishings. 3. It is in Vegas, I will eat at Providence for a lot less and not deal with the strip traffic/people/energy consumption.  4. Ah yes, this is the main rub. IT IS STUPID EXPENSIVE. The cost of doing business with fedex, the wynn, and the desert I guess.  Part of the issue is that you are also buying fish by the pound/kg and therefore when you buy that bream you really don't know how much you are going to spend. In fancy places you don't talk about money, so it can be a bit of a shock when bill comes. Be prepared for this, close you eyes and enjoy the fish.

Nzl2DtuCx9_ynQF2eH39Hg.text: Red royal shrimp from the coast of spain.  Langoustine off the coast of italy.  Seppia pasta and awesome parmigiano custard with black truffles.  They quite possibly had the best vongole i have ever eaten in my life.  Why are you so far away Bartolotta?  You get what you pay for and this was one of the best dinners I have had in my life.  Luca the server was so attentive and gracious and just a pleasure.  We were seated outside on a beautiful February night.  It was just fantastic.  Everything was perfect the pasta was just sublime.  I have to say that the only complaint is that we didn't have more time to enjoy more off the menu.  Cheers and happy Eats!

nf01phlI0NBosKOOen_hKA.text: Wasn't bad.  Very good service. Pretty good food.    What turned me was the deceptive pricing.  In the pasta section of the dinner menu, the price listed is actually for their "appetizer size portion" not their "dinner portion".  Evidently, there is some really fine print at the bottom of the menu to this effect.  The bottom line is, I thought I was ordering $24 plate of pasta, but was charged $56.  I would have been disappointed with the dish at the $24 price point.  The abusive pricing made the disappointment particularly bitter.

CHoJRt3AkGQhBT1f9qwv4g.text: What was good was great, and what wasn't was just okay, but not terrible. Good news first - the langoustines were easily one of the best things we had all night, and I'm not sure I've ever had such perfectly cooked scallops. The vongole were also a big hit, as was the parmesean custard, which was on the vegetarian menu. The higlight of our meal BY FAR was a buttery fresh pasta dish with a layer of fresh truffles shaved on top. It was so amazing, I can't even.   On to the bad - I thought my octopus salad was a little chewy, but it was dressed in a really high quality olive oil, which was delicious. So it might just have been an eexecution thing, or maybe I'm really picky about octopus. I also thought the lasagnette fell totally flat. The pasta was kind of gummy and the sauce wasn't anything special. I also thought the lobster was just okay, it wasn't as tender as I like.  This is not a place for you if you are in a rush. We were seated 10 minutes late for our reservation and it was a while before anyone took our drink order or gave us menus. I'm all for taking my time with dinner but, please, give me a drink first! Not sure I'd return...

36XSFRX9fO5A_vd04meeNw.text: The place have a beautiful terrace, very romantic. The food although good and the waiter very attentive The place is a little over priced for the quality of food.

52jNXrvfziXSRz4Wg2lRmA.text: Wow what can  I say about this place? This has to be one of the best Italian places I've ever been.  I can't give 5 stars though because while food, service and ambiance were amazing the wine prices by bottle were highest I've ever seen.  I get it's Vegas, but wow.   First off it's The Wynn so you know it's top notch. The decor and ambience is pure class and sophistication.   I went with 2 starter courses of gnocchi and stuffed ravioli paired with Chianti (by the glass).  At first bite I was floored by both dishes.  Words can't describe how delicious!  The cheese and sauce glaze on ravioli really paired great.  The gnocchi was cooked to perfection and paired w light red sauce.    Lastly, if you are a fish fan you'll love this place too.  They wheel up to your table fresh whole entire fish on ice then they run through each selection.  This place is all class. Definitely take a special lady there...you'll be happy you did ;)

7aUZr154x6YeF5gBel6Zmg.text: A mixed bag.  Service: Very good to great, 4 or 5 stars out of 5. Food: Inconsistent: 2 stars out of 5 Value: Poor: 1 stars out of 5 Overall: 2.5 stars out of 5  Dinner with spouse on October 8th.    Service: Greeted by a knowledgeable waiter.  Cocktail prepared exactly to custom order.  The server knew the menu well, did a little bit of an upsell - not too hard.  Dishes were prepared as expected, and were served without delay.  Excellent work by the waiters and bussers.  Food: (1) Scampi (Langostines) were not prepped well.  Claws were not cracked, neither were the legs.  Lobster crackers were not provided - Left about 40% of best meat in the shell.  Poor thinking on behalf of the head chef and poor value.  Tail was tasty.  (2) Lasagnette con ragu di crostacei was delicious, however the pasta was a little overdone.  Seasoning and taste were very good.  (3) Tagliatelle con porcini was average at best.  Pasta (again) was a bit overdone and did not look or feel house-made.  Porcini tasted odd - I suspect previously frozen or otherwise preserved.  (4) Veal chop was great.  Cooked to right (medium) doneness, Well seasoned, delicious.  Spinach was done right, and the cauliflower puree was tasty and the right texture.    Overall,  - great service; - decent (not great) food, - so-so value, mainly because food fell short of the promise. Will give them another whirl tomorrow.

H81m2FnMXBdHafRIJuBjjw.text: Yes, this was the 2nd most expensive place I've eaten in Vegas (Guy Savoy was tops at over $300/pp) but it was definitely worth it.  Dining upstairs is nothing special in terms of setting but service is amazing.  All the fish was amazing, the focaccia was light and tasty and the marscapone ravioli were not to be missed, one of the tastiest things I have ever eaten.   I had been looking forward to the octopus but really that was just average, the fish crudo was much better, the garlic clams were amazing and the scallop in the beurre blanch sauce with peas and pistachios was perfect.  For entree I had the sole in brown butter sauce, excellent but I was already getting full.  Gelato was fine, I liked the pineapple sorbet better. Cappuccino was ok.  Despite the cost I felt it was worth it, there was some cream here and there but overall a great southern/coastal Italian cuisine experience, think olive oil and simply grilled fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish chandelier, love it

yRs2SREyRkYtkl5swLFCcg.text: We were looking for an elegant, high class meal for clients. This place did not disappoint.   The meal was not cheap but was worth the cost. The staff was attentive, didn't rush us, had great recommendations and the wine was amazing.   The food was out of the world. I had an amazing piece of fish table side filleted. It was heaven.   If you can afford a second mortgage, go.

k-3ZHuEHUq5gNRjJhT_tXw.text: I can only give this restaurant a 2 star rating. I did a lot of research looking for a great restaurant to celebrate our anniversary. We settled on Costa di Mare. I called them several times to ensure they knew it was our anniversary and to make sure we had a special table. When we arrive we were shown a crappy table not even in the main dining area but on the top level. The hostess was clueless. We were just unsatisfied and thought we would leave but Manager convinced us to stay. That's for we went wrong. We should've left. They finally found us a decent table but not in the area we requested. We wanted to be outdoors. We were never told that there was a $300 minimum to sit outside. Which we easily spend anyway. Brings me to the next point. My husband and I split everything which we generally do because we like to share different tastes. We asked the waiter for a suggestion on fish. We shared one fish which the waiter chose. We had no idea of the price. We were shocked when we got the bill 143. for the fish. It was nothing special. Good but again nothing special. We've  been to plenty of 5 star restaurants in Vegas and all over the world. I would never recommend or go back. By the way we loved Picasso at the Wynn. I would definitely recommend that one.

RE4yaN3kj_c9iMnWZOmcSA.text: I wasn't on Yelp back in the summer of 2005 when the restaurant first opened.  If I was, I would have definitely written a review of this place.  Just for the pure laugh factor.  Their fish presentation was atrocious and hilarious at the same time.  The waiter came out with a tray of dead fish with live, unidentifiable crustaceans crawling all over the dead fish.  My male friend and I could not stop laughing and my more sensitive female friend screamed.  Needless to say, we ordered the pasta.  Fast forward to last weekend when we met some friends here for dinner.  We reserved a cabana table outside and the weather was perfect.  The dead fish with live creepy crawlies on a platter presentation is gone, unfortunately, and replaced with a rolling cart of all dead sealife on ice.  Not sure I get the point of either presentation methods.  But the service by Antonio was impeccable and the food -  delicious.  As others have said, this place is expensive.  If that is a problem, just look at the menu, conveniently posted outside away from the hostess stand, and don't come in.  But if you are looking for a special night out, the tasting menu combined with some expert pairing from the sommelier (Jennifer) is a must.    We got the Bravo's Top Chef tasting menu ($175 per person).  The TV advertisement placement on a tasting menu is a little cheesy, I admit, but the execution was very good.  Everything is served family style, which is fun and different for a tasting menu.  Plus, you get a great variety of their seafood and pasta dishes, including a whole fish.  Tasty and Jennifer introduced us to some great new wines.  Sometimes red wine does go with fish!  Great desserts, too.  The outside seating is on a separate reservation system, so keep that in mind when calling.  Also, you may not want to sit outside if you have a fear of bugs.  There are not a lot of them but they do exist, even in Vegas.  Plus, the weather must be perfect.  I asked and they do close it when it is windy.  Inside or outside, I suggest this restaurant for a special and unique night out.

QZhW6sq26zfxPxq5KXaDlA.text: Vegas in October perfect weather and a perfect opportunity to check out new dining options after a full day of Golf and the prelude to an evening of gambling at our favorite Casino. Of course being with 7 Guys plus myself who don't go to Vegas that often and allowing them to select a restaurant of their choice they came up with Bartolotta in the Wynn.   Arriving to a handsomely appointed two story dining experience with Crystal Chandeliers, well appointed bar, spiral staircase to the lower level which was a more romantic setting along with some upstairs tables off to the side where are party of 8 began our adventure into the world of "Mediterranean Seafood" After being seated ordering a good amount of pre dinner drinks we began to peruse this rather shall we say interesting menu.  Also our waiter rolled a cold tank on wheels to our table opening up to show us the various fresh fish not normally found on your North American Menu's with some live  "Langoustines" which to be honest look like some sort of cross between a Lobster, giant shrimp and nuclear reactor mishap.   It's a diverse menu with many items as stated you don't see regularly.   7 persons ordered the "TASTING MENU" and 1 person stuck to the land lover route. Let me do the Land Lover first having an appetizer of the Ravioli Toscana which was made with sheep's milk ricotta, and Marsala wine glaze. Perhaps the best thing that was tasted all night $17.00.  His entree was a Grilled Veal Chop with a Rosemary glaze mashed potatoes and a vegetable. Good but nothing great at $52.00  The Tasting menu of $175.00 per person went something like this.   Each dish contained exactly 7 items or enough for 7 persons to share.  Sea Scallops, the afore mentioned nuclear reactor type langoustines, Octopus salad, Sardines, Various dishes of pasta with vegetables and fish, risotto with fish, Fresh Bronzini, some clams, Tuna, and yada yada yada.  They threw in without telling us some deserts that they up the $175.00 per person to $187.00  Last but not least the wine list was so over priced I almost gagged.  I won't even get into trying to describe each dish as look it was fresh, it was different but this is simply NOT MY TYPE OF PLACE and no matter how much I tried, I couldn't nor could 7 of our 8 dining patrons justify anything about the price or food that would every make me consider going back.  The service was top notch the place very nice, but I don't get the draw unless your European and like this type of food or simply craving to be knee capped with a bill that was almost $1900.00 for 8 of us with Wine & Drinks.  Sorry Guys EL PASO.    This is the second restaurant I've eaten at the Wynn / Encore that was awful upon conclusion aside from the ambience and the service so perhaps I see a trend here. With so many other options in Las Vegas I'll stick to what I know.

aUQ4KPtfzUxOBRDzPze1cw.text: Why the low ratings people? Bartolotta was genuinely a great meal with great service. We had no complaints at all well except that we didn't have enough time to enjoy our dinner.    We made reservations for 4 here for a Saturday the day of and had no problems getting in for around 7:15. They asked us if it was for any special occasion and we told them that it was a bachelorette party.  Once we arrive, we only waited a few minutes to be showed to our table. This restaurant is very impressive and the decor is bold and rich and very thoughtful. We were greeted by the hostess that lead us down the spiral staircase to our table. It was so wonderful because we were sat by the open windows overlooking the lagoon and the outside Cabanas. We couldn't have asked for a better table with the exception of the cabanas of course.  After being seated, we were greeted by our lovely, fun, and energetic server, Antonio, from Sicily, Italy. He was so great the entire time. Because we were scared that we wouldn't make it to our show, Le Reve, I informed him that we were trying to catch a show. His response, "Bella I and fly to Italy and back in that time." Later we found out from our sommelier who'd overheard my question that Antonio in fact could. He was a pilot in the Italian Air Force. I love that it was an upscale place but made us feel relax and the staff wasn't stuffy.  Our sommelier helped us picked out a mid price bottle of white wine to accommodate our dinner.   Fist course: The seared Scallops, which were perfectly cooked, but nothing special and was overpriced for 2 pieces. We also ordered the seafood risotto and the seafood lasgnatte. Both were tasted wonderful and had great consistency.   Second Course: We ordered a snapper baked in a lemon garlic butter. It is brought out whole and the server plates it table side. We ordered the acqua pazza which is garlic, tomatoes, and white wine. It was light with enough acidic and sweetness to balance with the the light flaky fish. This was my favorite part of the meal.  Dessert: We decided to skip out on the dessert because for one we were cutting it close and the other we were completely satisfied from the dinner.     I will definitely be coming back to Bartolotta for the fresh selection of seafood, the great wine, and of course the outstanding service.  Oh and it didn't hurt that the table next to us ordered us a couple of free rounds of drinks too ;)

hchOmeU2sfwy8ioxArHZ4Q.text: Beautiful view and yummy just like Bartolotta's was, even the same staff!  Except for the octopus dish, which was melt on your mouth in a different way, all was basically the same.  Love the same bartenders and servers at the bar.  I was alittle disappointed at first that Bartolotta's wasn't there anymore.  But they remembered me and recommended items that were similar to what I used to order.  Awesome!  Starting with the beautiful bread basket that I only took a tiny bite of each since we ordered so much.  Tasty and fantastic.    An absolutely must starter is the octopus! POLIPO LIGURE ALLA GRIGLIA Grilled octopus, rapini, crispy potatoes, & a red pepper sauce all melts in your mouth.   RAVIOLI DI RICOTTA CON CACIOTTA TOSCANA the sheep's milk ricotta ravioli, Tuscan pecorino cheese and sweet touch of marsala wine glaze was absolutely divine.  Every bite was mmm with my eyes closed.  Mmm!    CAPESANTE DORANTE CON PISELLI DI PRIMAVERA seared to perfection sea scallops, spring pea puree, lemon and pistachio.  Flavorful and a perfect combination together.  Lovely dish.    SINFONIA DI DOLCE AND PISTACHIO MOUSSE Wow!  Dessert was absolutely mind blowing!  The wafer and presentation along with the flavors of pistachio mousse and fruit I'll have to work my way backwards next time... from dessert to starter.    The wine and champagne list absolutely perfect pairings for their menu.  Wynn knows how to keep me coming back with his decisions on chefs he brings.  I was also disappointed when he switched the restaurant Switch years ago, and Society into a Poker room, but was very please with the replacements throughout so I should trust him more often in restaurant choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert is where I&#39;ll start next time.  My themed dinner was obviouslu pistachios &amp; this wafter was to die for delish.
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring peas pureed w/ pistachios over perfectly seared sea scallops!
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sheeps milk ricotta ravioli w/ a sweet taste of Marsala wine glaze.

wO_uJD68MqZLoXBT_XV_bw.text: This is the update for my old review of Bartolotta. Recently visited Costa di Mare again and I should say that their superb service and food has remained almost unchanged. Although I would say that I do feel a slight decline in food and service. And when I say service, I don't mean that the service was bad or slow, they just do a lot more upsetting now than before. Otherwise fish is as fresh and it used to be and all other items on the menu are worth trying. I'd say my favorite one is a squid ink pasta! This is a solid 4.5 star place.

elW0VNoFT5AK6LnD3ergnA.text: One of the worst restaurant experiences of my life. The bread was old, stale. My meal was impossibly salty. I sent it back and it came out worse. My dinner guests agreed and all said their food was bleh.   It was also horrendously noisy and loud.

57rf5meSbT2af8lyOm4zUg.text: Came here last night to have dinner with girlfriends and to celebrate a birthday. Staff was very courteous and accommodating. We tried a variety of apps as well as a fish entree and the Porterhouse. There were 2 pasta apps that really stood out. The cuttlefish ink pasta and the linguine with white wine, garlic etc. Not only was the linguine delicious with the garlic, parsley and white wine combo, it also took me back to my dad's home cooking. Yummy! I thought the presentation of the Porterhouse was impressive, however, it was bland and lacking in flavor. The 'Field to Glass' cocktail was light and refreshing. You can't go wrong with organic vodka, basil and rosemary-rhyme infused syrup. Try the panna cotta, light and creamy deliciousness.

LYWYvgZMaF4cyWEIuByB5A.text: Really outstanding seafood and service! It's cool that they bring the fresh fish around to your table for you to choose. We had sea bream which was buttery and tender.  We also sampled all their desserts, literally.  They were all amazing!

Fbw7GCksXMBd1lQREnbJyw.text: Very tasty food & wonderful experience. This restaurant is open for dinner nightly from 5:30 to 10 p.m. Here is what I ordered and it was very yummy. So I highly recommend the following:  - One large langoustine - grilled Ligurian octopus, crispy potatoes, Taggiasche olives, roasted pepper sauce        - fresh garganelli, red and blue shrimp, lobster, spider crab, white wine, tomato - roasted garlic rack of Colorado lamb, pepper relish, chick pea fries, roasted garlic sauce

2A2Q_UiLwwSe_liEKFUJZA.text: Bugs!  Terrible service, wrong order and food was sub-par.  This review is limited to the outdoor eating area.  Perhaps, the wait staff indoor was more amicable but our waiter outside was absolutely terrible and rude.  He never checked on us the entire time.   Instead he spent a majority of his time talking with the couple in the next table.  Great way to make us feel special!  The absolute worst was his response to my wife and I when we asked him to change the table linen and place setting because it was covered in bugs.  He said, "you're sitting outside what do you expect?!" He didn't change or clean a thing.  We had to wipe our utensils down.    The food orders were wrong. I ordered a vegan ravioli.  I received the regular ravioli stuffed with cheese.  The risotto wasn't any good.  Took two bites, ate the bread and asked for the check.    This restaurant is just sad.  It was a Friday night and it looked like an empty nursing home.   I usually stay at Encore when I go to Vegas.  Typically, grab dinner and a show within the hotel but this experience was so bad that I will not be staying there again.

SktSEZS0FxDRGrixPC4r9w.text: 5 Stars for romantic views, ambiance, food, drinks and service. Do splurge on the cabana ... unless it is 100 degrees outside!!! Jerman was the best !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apps Spread and Bread Choice accompaniments

hjYOuV-gyG3-ju3NLewLwg.text: Don't get me wrong, service is great and scenery is nice. The food sucks. This place didn't impress me at all. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. It's a waste.. put your money towards gambling instead.

6aflSBuiKzr-lulRW9686w.text: I love fine dining so I was excited to dine at Costa di Mare.  In terms of ambiance, it's beautiful provided you get a water side or nice lower level table. Tables upstairs have a totally different vibe similar to a cafe. The hostess was great and accommodated our request for a water side table.   I love wine so I planned on buying a nice bottle. Unfortunately, I didn't like their wine list which was primarily Italian wines and all their wine was excessively marked up (400%+). The least expensive options I could find were around $160 for an average cab that retails for $35.   The menu is very exciting if you love seafood as much as myself. The only gotcha is their fresh fish is priced in grams and the typical fish is $130-150. We opted to stick with apps and pasta.   Apps. We started with the octopus, which was good and tender. The only issue was the dish was served warm, not hot. We moved on to the crudo sampler of four fishes, which had good flavor and seemed fresh.   Pasta. Our pasta took around 30-40 mins after we finished the apps. When asked we were politely told the chef was not happy with them and they had to remake them. I appreciated the honesty, but we had a show to catch. The first two pastas were a cheese ravioli and a papperadelle. The raviolis were over powered by the cheese and the papperadelle featured nice home home made pasta, but a lot of salt.   More pasta. The next two pasta dishes were the linguine with clams and the cuttlefish ink ribbon pasta. Both featured too much salt and the taste was not there. We sent both back.   To their credit the manager recognized we were not happy with the food and the kitchen was slow.  They brought out a few complimentary deserts despite us urging them it was not necessary. At this point we had seen enough and we had a show to catch. The deserts were just okay.   So in summary, great atmosphere if you get the right table, poor wine list, overpriced fresh fish, below average pasta, etc.  could have been an off night, but I know I will not be back.

a-gKAQyCYzz35OJYNt4Qww.text: I wanted to love this restaurant but was extremely disappointed. The service was good as expected. We decided on the lobster and, at the recommendation of our waiter, chose the home-made spaghetti to go with it. Both the lobster and spaghetti were unremarkable and average at best. The wine, the gelato dessert, and the special chocolates the waiter brought over as we were finishing up were the high points of the dinner.  Restaurant was great in contacting me to review the issues and resolve :)

LAJm9iGpl4U8ALhja6xjUA.text: I decided to take my husband here for our 10 year anniversary. I was very impressed with the scenery and ambiance of the restaurant. I also heard rave reviews and was excited since I wanted our anniversary dinner for be a great one.   Upon our arrival, we were seated downstairs. We waited a while to get the menu (for drinks only). As our waiter came to our table, I get the feeling that he was not at all happy to have been serving us. I tired to ignore my feelings as I was red this dinner to be an enjoyable one.   As the night progressed, it became more and more obvious that our waiter was "annoyed". I am not sure exactly at what but it was obvious because even my husband turned to me and said he didn't seem happy. We tried to make the best of what the situation was. When we ordered our drinks, my husband's drink came back watered down. Totally unexpected . Costa Di Mare is highly rated and based on the menu prices, I did not expected to receive a watered down drink especially when I am paying for it.   We ordered pasta along with the Branzino. Don't bother asking the waiter what he recommends because you will just get attitude. Overall, I do not recommend this place. They are rude and the food is not at all great. Totally not worth it. I would suggest that you take your business elsewhere. Candidly speaking I have gone to restaurants where the food wasn't all that great but because the experience was so amazing, I will return multiple times and recommend to my friends and family.   I am not a resident of Las Vegas but my husband and I constantly visit because we just love Vegas. I would suggest that you take your business elsewhere because you will be treated as a one time customer here.

QUR9g6aorFvH3tCELhVO7w.text: This place has the best Italian food. Their seafood pasta (shrimp,  crab and fish) is extremely flavorful. Their wines, can't stop with just 1 glass. And the tiramisu is luscious. It's a great place to celebrate an occasion with upscale ambience, friendly service and a relaxed atmosphere. The server helped us with really good recommendations for our palate.

XZdjOKJkRCWkZs7Xm6HEwA.text: Ive got to try this place!! Saw them on Snapchat and was almost ready to eat my phone!!

bCTPaSfJubG4q-JP3byd1A.text: The ambiance of the outdoor seating is phenomenal. The fresh fish cases were amazing. The food quality was on another level. All of that said, there are downsides to this restaurant that do need to be brought up to speed to truly make this a perfect dining experience.   We ate here with a party of 8 and had an overall great experience. I ordered the cuttlefish ink pasta, truffle lobster tail app and a jumbo languistine. My food was perfect, the truffle lobster was one of the best pieces of lobster I've ever eaten. Others at the table didn't ask or understand portion sizes and some ended up with way too much or way too little in terms of portion. My wife ordered the lobster risotto and the dish was missing acidity and was a bit over cooked. For those who ordered whole fish, it was finished tableside and was a great spectacle to observe.   The good: fish quality is impeccable-the best in Vegas, the staff is friendly, the dishes (for the most part) are well conceived and well executed, and the decor is well done.   The bad: No explanation was provided about portion sizes except for ordering a whole fish.  Drink orders were lagging and the waitstaff didn't do a great job ensuring the table was properly served on this level. Many times, drinks had to be asked for rather than the server asking.

o3gneSDx4Rcq4UQIZDv8EQ.text: Beautiful restaurant for my birthday. He chose the seafood tasting course.  Seafood risotto, seared scallops, seared massive prawns, salt encrusted branzino, artichoke amise bouche, ricotta ravioli, squid ink pasta with assorted seafood. Omg their bread was awesome: ciabatta, olive loaf, chantarelle mushroom bread with ricotta and truffle spread. The lovely dessert was a tasting tray of gelato, cheesecake, assorted beignets with 3 dipping sauces. $521.00 for dinner including tip. Service was.phenomenal and Randy made my birth day wonderful. I loved this restaurant. Beautiful view of a large koi pond.

s7AORiVnSLZs2GYmJsnRXA.text: We were a group of 20 with the back room booked.  We did a pre set menu with 3 choices for each course as well as wine and drinks.  The service was absolutey top notch.  The staff was attentive with out being around too much.  They were even able to accommodate a last minute ask for a cakr and champagne celebration at the end of the meal.  The food was very good.  All the salad were fresh and tasty.  The grilled octopus was interesting and the others (caprese and arugula with mushrooms) were okay.  For the mains, the fush was beautiful andvthe steak good though more than 4 ppl said it was overcooked.  The risotto and ravioli were absolutely delicious.  I would recommend this restaurant for any business dinner.  It was very convenient how they had the pre set menu and the staff was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Molten chocolate cake was perfect with champagne

7bNyZx3EFxXqLy2Mwi27KA.text: Overrated tourist trap! Our waiter was high on something kept dropping things and spilling water on us every time. He also would get super close with a terrible breath! Got our food wrong and would never come back to check on the cold mediocre food we ate. Do yourself a favor, skip this place.

XjflARFTh8VQMx8vB1HLWg.text: Came here with my husband and my mom for my birthday because I really wanted some seafood risotto. Such a beautiful restaurant and the staff wonderfully welcoming!  We chose to do outside seating because the weather was so nice.  From the time we sat down, our waiter was responsive and very helpful. We ordered water for the table and then ordered our food. While we waited for the food, we were offered 4 different types of bread. They were all HARD, barely even edible. Like the bread would disintegrate in your hand if you tried to break it in half.   It didn't take too long for the food to come out.  Personally,  the risotto did not have much flavor to me. I had to add an abundance of salt and pepper to really enjoy it. The good part was that they are not stingy with the seafood. Every bite was filled with seafood. Then came the chocolate dessert. I'm not a chocolate fan so I let the others enjoy that part.  Otherwise, it wasn't terrible, but it wasn't the best I've ever had either.
