uOmmniqfaW8GPDa-8jp7cA.text: Anyone who gives this restaurant less than 5 is an idiot that doesn't know better....absolutely the best in class from service to food.  I wish I could give them 6 stars. Can't wait to go back

woVhpmE3EAEnP6FWM5xF9g.text: The food was great but watch out for the fish priced by the ounce.  We paid $200 for a damn fish.

Y5uEmJsP-DTEf6DpXh6Ecg.text: Not only was eating at Costa di Mare one of the highlights of my Las Vegas trip, it was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had. I was completely blown away by the outstanding service, the beautiful atmosphere, and the delicious food. This was the epitome of a 5-star experience.  Two of us were celebrating our birthdays the night we went to Costa di Mare. This was mentioned when we made the reservation and they went out of their way to give us one of the nicest tables in the house. The restaurant has extensive indoor dining but we were seated outside beside a beautiful koi pond. Our table had a tent covering and heat lamps for when the sun went down. Even though it was a pretty full house, the table felt very intimate.  Our waiter started by asking if we had any dietary requirements. When I mentioned I was vegetarian, he left and came back with a special vegan/vegetarian menu. I was completely blown away. Normally at restaurants like this I need to cobble a meal together with appetizers and sides. Here I had a full menu to choose from. I found out later that every restaurant at the Wynn and Encore hotels has separate vegan/vegetarian menus. Amazing!  The food and drinks are expensive ($20 cocktails omg) but definitely worth it. Since it was my birthday, I treated myself to an unreal gin cocktail before my meal. I ended up eating a delicious pastry topped with arugula, tomatoes, and vegan ricotta. Y'all, it literally melted in my mouth. This was food heaven! My friends were all blown away by their seafood dishes. Two of the girls ordered a meal for two where the servers cut and served their fish right at the table. Not my jam obviously but it was very cool to see.  Throughout the evening, the service was attentive and pleasant. The server offered helpful suggestions for wine pairings and made sure we were happy with our meals. The crowning moment was when they brought out two "happy birthday" desserts for the two of us celebrating birthdays. It was incredibly thoughtful and definitely made our night.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing gin cocktail
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special birthday dessert. So thoughtful!

NO5i44-f_wA8kUHFFZT2rA.text: This was our third time back at costa. The food quality is always top notch. We shared apps and pasta. I must say all the pastas were cooked perfectly. Our service was good but not overbearing or intrusive. The aperitif cart is such a nice touch. We had one of the grappas.  Highly recommended!

qpkPAhrol5QhNJBp5s5Q2A.text: Seriously the best of the best. Second time here and although pricey it's truly an experience. The freshest most delectable seafood and tastes you'll experience. Highly recommend.

hZaZedbiL3XxjAkWoa8iuQ.text: This restaurant is beautiful with its own little lake and outstanding lighting. The service is five *****. We eat a plant-based diet, and Wynn is known for its vegan menus being available at every one of its eateries. Thus, we decided this was a good place to celebrate our wedding anniversary.   After being promptly seated, we were welcomed with a personalized anniversary card. And after our water was served and our wine ordered, we were brought a mini artichoke appetizer.   The bread tray was also brought to us, where 2 of 4 of the breads were vegan.  The vegan/vegetarian menu was limited, but a few items on the vegetarian menu were actually vegan, so that was nice.  Note: every course and item was brought to us at a timely pace, and we must have had 3 or 4 waiters assigned to our table. Everything was presented well and impeccably timed.  I ordered the ensalada misto, which was super yummy but had too many tomatoes, to my taste, and I love tomatoes. The whole dish was bright and pretty and incredibly fresh. Just the right size portion.  My husband had the chickpea cakes with artichokes. I tasted it as well,  and it was very nicely spiced. We both enjoyed it. But note, this is the second dish with artichokes, and there were just a couple of hot dishes for appetizers and three for entree choices on the vegan menu.  Next I ordered the risotto with mushrooms. And my husband had the vegan ravioli with mushrooms and artichokes. Note the artichokes again.  My husband's ravioli dish was very tasty and textured but on the salty side. On the other hand, my risotto was nearly tasteless. No spice, salt, pepper, nothing. And no peppers or salts were offered at any point in our dining experience. We didn't ask either only because each dish was nicely spiced, already too salty, or just tasteless and needed far more than salt or pepper.  I reported my dish as tasteless and requested another dish of the ravioli. In the meantime, my husband romantically fed me some of his dish while I waited for mine. My replacement dish arrived in a timely manner and I shared some of mine with him. I was not upset, and they handled the whole thing very well.  Note: the entrees were lacking in color and imaginative presentation. I'd have dressed up the plates with some decorative veggies.  Next, we ordered the vegan dessert plate that included an almond ice cream, chocolate cake, and cherries. We also ordered a  latte and a cognac.   They brought out the dessert and it was stunning with a "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate on the plate. The cherries were rich, deep dark red, and marinated. The cake was so so, but the ice cream was yummy and round like a tennis ball and dipped in a wonderful hardened dark chocolate and topped with just a little bit of gold leaf. It was presented to us as complimentary, I assume because of the entree issue.  The coffee took a little too long and came out as plain decaf with almond milk on the side. The waiter apologized without prompting as he knew something wasn't quite right. I told him I would love to have it myself and that my husband would still like the latte. In a few minutes the latte arrived with a little dish of three bite-size vegan desserts!  In the end, we received a lot of complimentary items, all without requesting to have them free, including the artichoke appetizer, the dessert platter, the coffee, the latte, and the mini dessert dish.   In addition, the service and ambiance were perfect. Plus, while we didn't request a waterside table, we were seated by a window overlooking the little lake.  Overall, it was a wonderful evening and experience. However, the vegan menu is lacking in imagination. Too much artichoke and mushroom, and I love both. Too salty, in one case, and completely bland in another. Boring presentation without much color.  With some more thought and imagination, this could be an A+ experience for vegans. And I thank the entire staff for making our anniversary beautiful. Thank you!!!!

53Qr_TGiIqx0QNUDWb-wyw.text: This place was pretty good, I would give it a 5 stars except I think the portion for price is a little high.  The service was amazing from the minute we walked in until we left. It's as if you have a small little team that's there to take care of all your needs. Our waiter gave great suggestions and answered every question for us maybe even twice.   We started off with the scallop appetizer that just melted in my mouth, I could have eaten that entree as my entire meal. Since I like to treat myself when I'm traveling it wasn't the only thing I had of course!  For the second / main course I did two pasta dosages. The lobster with tomato sauce was amazing I wish I did that as an entire portion. The noodles were just the right consistency for this sauce and the lobster was perfectly cooked full of flavor.  The other dish I got was the pappardelle, which I'm not sure I would get again. The noodles were great but the mushrooms to me had the texture and taste of canned mushroom.  The last course for me was the gelato which was amazing!! I'm a huge gelato fan as this hit the spot for me!

Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WRCb5bbxEV7hc3Fy-_0Tbg.text: Below average, my seafood pasta was tasteless. Had to add a lot of chili flakes and tomatoes from another dish my friend ordered to bring it to life. Branzino looked good but again no flavor. The appetizers came fast. The squid was bitter. The main entrees took for ever to come even though the restaurant was not busy at all. Over all very disappointing. First and last time here.

JiNS8RXfJGCi0OYb7YBbBQ.text: I'm confused by all these people who give this place poor reviews. This was an easy 5 Star for my lady and I.   First off the service. WOW!! Antonio, the main server was knowledgeable, attentive, appreciative, and informative about the entire menu and what to expect from our time with them. The sommelier was evenly as informative and attentive as the rest of the wait staff. When he noticed I was struggling with deciding from the extensive list, he was quick to help me make a choice. The remaining staff didn't allow my water or wine glass to ever run dry. They all told us about every course of our tasting menu option that we opted for as it was served to us.   Now onto the food. Again, WOW!!! The family style tasting menu was so inclusive of the most notable parts of the main menu that I do not feel as if there was anything more I need to try or missed out on. The appetizers were unreal and delicious. The pasta was so fresh and obviously made in house. The grilled crustacean add on was totally worth it. The crusted fish entree was out of this universe!   Literally a dining experience that will not be soon forgotten.

qLzDqZipn1aLeIHuXZtzRg.text: This review is not going to be pleasant as our experience was not the best.  First, the place was elegant and high class. When I entered to the restaurant, I was astonished by the interior and friendliness for the front desk girls. No doubt, for interior and welcome staff 5 stars.  Next, we got table downstairs by the window with the cozy view of outside. The first negativity I got from our server. I felt like he was some snobby and pussy. He didn't explain the menu or concept of the restaurant, but they were probably busy because of CES convention. I don't drink much in general and one glass of wine is always enough for me for all evening. We asked for the glasses of wine but server was pushing to get bottle or half of bottle. I felt strange because we stated that my boyfriend drank red and I white. By the way, glass of wine costed 70$- Vegas baby :) besides, the wine wasn't that good too.  We ordered for appetizers scallops and beef carpaccio. Of course, the waiter pushed me to add truffles on my scallops, so I did. In general, I like truffles so it was not big deal. When I was ordering main course- a fish, the waiter again was pushing to add truffles but I declined. I didn't like his attitude at all.  When our appetizers arrived I was pleased by the presentation of the dish. However, when I tasted I disliked my appetizer- it was too salty. I even couldn't finish the scallops. Normally, I would refuse to eat and change to another appetizer, but I couldn't waste the truffles. So I ate as much as I could and I left 30% of the dish. Of course I felt bitter and unsatisfied of my experience because the appetizer costed 100$.  No complaints about main menu- the pasta and fish were delicious. However, we waited for the main dishes for 30 min. We couldn't fully enjoy our meal because we were hurry for the show. Besides, I asked for side plate of pasta, I got full entree plate of pasta. Did I mention that server was pushy?  In the end, we ended up with over 600$ bill + 130$ tip. Then, the server came and explained how the menu worked because the menu was confusing lol. This was just for 2 so-so appetizers- scallops and carpaccio, 3 wine glasses, fish with pasta and mussels with pasta. 700$ dinner could taste better and experience could be better. Honestly, we are not going to return here. Maybe to have drinks but not for dinner. The kitchen was not top notch. The place is overpriced and the servers are pushy. Instead going here, check SW, Mizumi or Sinatra- better service and wonderful food. Waste of money and time.

Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jTg53V5DoBa_udlY04DCFw.text: The atmosphere and service are really great. We were treated extremely well. The food was very disappointing... I can't even describe how bad it was. The waiter told us fresh fish was flown in from Italy daily...yeah right! Maybe monthly....at best. I grew up on the coast...this seafood and fishy was not fresh. Nothing was seasoned appropriately...bland, bland, bland. It was probably one of the worst meals I can ever remember. Do NOT believe these high reviews-these people do not know good food!! This place wouldn't stop stay open in Dallas for 2 weeks!! Waaaay overpriced and terrible!

6po-SucDbNPvtnF5PVRIew.text: This restaurant was a very highly anticipated dinner for me and my friends! It was considered our "fancy dinner" to celebrate one our friends getting married!   We made reservations a week in advance, had to postpone the reservation by 30 minutes on the day of and staff was accommodating.   Upon arriving we noticed how nice the outside seating was and asked if we could be seated outside, in which we were notified outside seating was all booked for the night. Of course it was. Note to self: be specific about seating when making reservations! No biggie though, we were still excited to eat here!   Pretty much before ordering someone will come by with their seafood cart and go over the selections for the day. Then baskets of bread will come out, which had at least 3 different types of bread and some spreads to go with it. The bread was hot and tasty.   We decided to do family style with selections of fried appetizers, mussels and tomato, caprese, spaghetti, risotto, filet, tiramisu and an assortment of donut delicacies to share. Everything was tasty, staff was attentive even though they didn't talk that much but kept our tables cleaned and refilled our waters, and candy assortments on the house at the end of the meal.   What's great is we got to eat in a very romantic setting with good food and we stayed within budget so I can't complain! =)

t_4atHkZ6KmS5bwqiQ0x4g.text: Eh, we tried to make last minute reservations on Christmas Eve and couldn't get into SW or The Country Club. I had a decent amount of resort credit to burn and after consulting with the reservationist for Wynn (very helpful, by the way), I decided to book our dinner at Costa di Mare.  We were seated side-by-side at a table for two at the base on the stairs. I didn't enjoy having to twist to the side to talk to my friend. We also felt like it was too much of a people watching table.   Anyway, upon being seated, we were handed the cocktail menu and wine list (no food menus). I honestly don't understand this. How am I supposed to choose a wine without looking at the food options? Service was not very attentive for a $$$$ restaurant and eventually, we flagged down a server to take away our drink menus and bring us food menus.  I didn't really know how big the pasta dishes were and we decided to share two pastas and one main course. We had the "maccheroni alla chitarra con ricci di mare" - hand rolled thick spaghetti, sea urchin, crab, tomato, lemon and "risotto ai frutti di mare "- risotto, scallops, shrimp, lobster, clams, crab, cuttlefish, octopus. The maccheroni was excellent and came with just enough sea urchin to be rich without overdoing it. I'm a sucker for risotto and this one was light and delicious but if I had to choose one, I'd go for the maccheroni for sure.  We had one order of the lamb chops to share and it was lovely that kitchen had already split the order onto two plates. By the time the lamb came, we had eaten so many carbs (there was also a lot of bread that was served before the pasta even came) and we were both quite full. The lamb was cooked beautifully and I liked the chick pea fries and eggplant that accompanied it. For $58, this was a fairly good value.  I think we would've been fine with just one pasta and one entree for two people.

sk0Ch098HNmpjF-HXir8Mw.text: not bad.. When i had first bite, the food didn't taste wow, more like so so but very strange that I couldn't stop eating them..so delicious as you keep chewing them..

15CDopO0aYF9DQ0AZAw8EA.text: Ever since I saw Costa Di Mare on the Travel Channel with Andrew Zimmern food show I wanted to try. I was in Las Vegas for a trade show and our company had a dinner there. We had a party of 14 and were seated in a beautiful private room. Our group were served the $170 level per person dinner not including the drinks. The wine and drinks flowed through out the night and the bill was over $3000 before tip. We were served the following   Starters Burratta with at least 5 choices of bread and bread sticks. The Burratta wad soft and creamy almost like butter.  Grilled langostine and octopus the langostine was excellent like a skinny lobster but the octopus was soft and flavorless  Lobster Penne pasta was perfect with the pasta more on the al dente side with cuts of lobster in a cream sauce.   John Dory fish wad the best of the meal light and delicate.   Grilled steak was very rare had a faint flavor of rosemary was under seasoned.   Dessert was a small light donut with gellato and a vanilla mousse.   Service was excellent. Located in the Wynn was not completely full on last Tuesday night.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Langostine and grilled octopus
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. John Dory and steak
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster penne

1S6VYemDpSDWobCKBCdR8Q.text: I went here the other night for my birthday. The atmosphere is very beautiful and romantic especially if you sit outside. However, while the fish is extremely fresh and cooked to absolute perfection it was very bland tasting to me as was everything else we ordered. We had the appetizer pastas, I was told it was fresh homemade pasta but mine was very hard like pasta from a box and undercooked, not Al Dente, Fresh pasta is never hard and cooks in about a minute or two. The sauce wAs lacking in flavor and when it was served no one came to ask if we wanted grated cheese or fresh pepper. We sat outside which was a bit pricey to do and late (9:30)and they were out langoustines so we were very disappointed. Last but not least, the portions are very very small. Not at all what I expected I wasn't expecting huge family size portions but seriously, this was small, expensive and bland. I wanted to try it, and see what is was all about but I probably would never go back, just wasn't good enough or worth the money.

DfVlT3sTE6BTxjABVAgBHw.text: Had birthday dinner here and seated in the patio which was awesome.. even thought it was 40 degrees out it was still nice and cool.   Note, men must wear pants otherwise you will not be able to eat here. They have loaner pants... anyways worth it. The squid ink pasta, mushroom parpadelle, zucchini blossom, fried fish... yum! Would definitely return.   Waiter was nice and not pushy at all. Made excellent recommendations. Same with sommelier!   Can't wait to go back!

4I9PyYJ2LnuucmQepsy90w.text: I'm not going to lie - as a vegan, I had a choice to eat at any other Wynn restaurant with a vegan menu but I chose this place. The absolute best part about this place is the decor and the service. We sat on the outside along the very pretty lake with floating orbs, and it was probably the prettiest dang place I've ever eaten at. Our two servers showered us with so much attention it almost bordered on weird. They were really cool though.  But I have to say for a  place this elegant and fancy, they would offer vegetarians/vegans something more than pasta. I have a feeling they could cook up something really special. The dessert was amazing and so were my drinks...but their salad and pasta offerings were super basic.  But wow, that setting. It was really frickin pretty. It made for a very special trip with my sister.

Z_mlpGDk-LyX28zvguCNcw.text: Insalata di carciofi, porcini, ruchetta e pecorino Sardo $22 sauteed artichokes, porcini mushrooms, wilted arugula, Sardinian pecorino  Polipo Ligure alla griglia $26 grilled Ligurian octopus, crispy potatoes, basil, arugula, pine nuts  Tagliatelle al nero di seppia $27.50 handmade cuttlefish ink ribbon pasta, cuttlefish, shrimp, lobster, spinach  Maccheroni alla chitarra con ricci di mare* $27.50 hand rolled thick spaghetti, sea urchin, crab, tomato, lemon  My wife and I came here for our Valentine's Day dinner. We were first led down some stairs where the dining room area is. The ambience with the view of the pool outside and the fancy curtains was quite amazing. I would have to say that this resto has one of the most comfortable dining areas I've ever been in. The service is top notch. Our waiter first gave us a run down of "today's catch" so to speak while actually showing us a mini "cooler" of the different kinds of fish and seafood.  We decided on 2 apps and 2 entrees. The grilled octopus was fantastic and tender. It was actually a big portion (around 5-6 pieces) for an app. I was disappointed with the salad at first glance but it actually tasted pretty good. It was good but I think $22 is pretty high for a vegetable only salad. My cuttlefish pasta dish was ok. The seafood in it tasted very fresh however. I thought my wife's seafood spaghetti had better texture and flavor though. Overall, I thought eating here was a great experience and a good place for celebrating a romantic occasion. I thought this restaurant has the best service of any resto I've been to in Vegas.

t-ZwzWUXemukE3Y4b6GKXw.text: This place was incredible!!!! Had the risotto and sea bass and everything was presented beautifully, tasted amazing and fresh. However what truly made this experience phenomenal was the service; it was impeccable!!!!! Luciano was knowledgable and kind and made our dinner an experience to remember. He made us feel special and like we were the only people in the restaurant!! I have a gluten allergy and he was able to accommodate this, even with dessert. I would highly recommend this place and if you want to feel like royalty; ask for Luciano!
