y_j0HyOdG7cLG8oMyyENEg.text: It will transport you to Italy (sans the 6,000 mile, $8,500 airfare).  The best, in season seafood, everything sustainably harvested,  direct from Italy, prepared simply, the Italian way.  Want to enjoy simply fried, seasoned with sea salt and a squeeze of lemon, moleche (soft shell crab) straight from the Lagoon in Venice?  You have four short weeks in the middle of of Autumn and again in the Spring.   Raw, sweet, briny ricci (sea urchins) from the pristine waters off Sicilly?  Make plans December through March.   Get the picture?  Note:  This is a composite review based on two visits in 2018.  Tip:  Dine family style where possible (you can try more and it feels more Italian).    Tip:  Focus on the seafood and definitely pass on the "meat".    To begin, the mixed crudo tasting is outstanding and showcases the freshness and characteristic flavor of Mediterranean seafood.  Thin strips of tender, sweet cuttlefish, sweet prawns, meaty amberjack and a surprise choice of the chef (usually an oily white flesh fish.  All delicately seasoned, drizzled with olive oil and the lightest kiss of citrus.  The langoustines, perfect.  Cooked from live, there is no degradation in the flesh which remains firm and very sweet with a kiss of oceanic goodness at the finish.   Split, grilled, drizzled with olive oil.  Perfect.    The same is True for the giant red shrimp.  Much more oceanic than Gulf shrimp, huge flavor and sweetness.  The head fat, very rich, briny finishing clean.  The moleche, simply fried.  Crisp on the outside, creamy on the inside.  Pop them in your mouth whole to release the briny, oceanic goodness that finishes clean and sweet.    The charcoal grilled Ligurian octopus and the Roman specialty fiore di zucca (deep fried zucchini flower with fresh anchovies and mozzarella) are both noteworthy and outstanding.  Whole fish in various preparations including salt crust is a specialty of the restaurant.  The selection will change daily.  Zero complaints with an orata (sea beam from Naples).  Moist, perfectly cooked.  The cicala di mara, the smaller relative of the cicala imperiale, another seasonal special, is exceptional.  Texturally, like a cold water lobster but the flavor is far more balanced and delicate.  The lingering sweetness of the typical lobster is replaced by a hard to describe citrus finish.  Clean and elegant.  Those wanting a more upfront lobster flavor should try the imperiale instead.  Both simply split and grilled dressed with olive oil.  Pastas, yes, have not tried any recently.  Service is outstanding, professional but relaxed in the proper Italian way.  Very good Italian centric wine list.  High Vegas resort markup.  Easily one of the top seafood restaurants in the city.

vvqsSv5DF_cEDwaG2LTLuw.text: Our 1st dinner of the trip & it was a solid start. We were able to get 1 of the last seatings of the evening.  It was right by the window to view the water.   It was also right by the kitchen so we could see the dishes as they were coming out.   Sampled several dishes to have a fuller experience - calamarata con scorfano, melanzane e pomodoro, ravioli di granseola Veneziana con ragu di crostacei, risotto ai frutti di mare, & the fish special.  All were tasty & nothing really stood out as something that I'd have again.    What did stand out was what neither of us will be having again - the spider ravioli (ravioli di granseola Veneziana con ragu di crostacei) is definitely an acquired taste & not one that either of us enjoyed.  The flavor needed a plate cleanser in between.   Great start to a fantastic trip :)

8uqZLJ00ekOXH95UIUXr5A.text: Spectacular tasting fish!!!  SEABREAM from the Mediterranean   Don't you dare not eat the skin!

rm_PKdIobh9j6kCMHneG9A.text: We decided to live our best lives in Vegas and indulge in the seafood tasting menu! Costa di Mare is a 4-star Forbes Travel Guide restaurant featuring seafood flown in from Italian waters 4 times a week. This was the best meal we had in Vegas at the Wynn!  Food: so good! The tasting menu was amazing with 5 courses and 11 dishes. One my favorite dish in the antipasti di mare course was the Sicilian amberjack crudo which 2 thin slices of fish with a sauce full of basil and garlic. My friend likes the clams which was cooked in a rich yet spicy tomato sauce. The langoustine was amazing! So fresh and grilled to perfection. I thought the ink past would be awful because it reminded me of black bean pasta but it was so fresh and soft, it's flavor surprised me. The fish dish was served with a tomato relish which was so flavorful you can put it on any savory dish and was definitely my favorite sauce. I was a bit disappointed in their symphony of deserts as I was surprised that it included 4 types of donuts. The best desert they gave us was a heavenly lemon desert. The restaurant gave it to us to celebrate my friend's birthday. It was very kind of them. There was so much food that we had to take some back to our hotel room!  Service: excellent! Staff was friendly and incredibly knowledgeable about seafood. They knew the details of every dish served and explained what it included and how it was prepared. The timing of the meal was well planned so we didn't wait long between courses. Our water and coffee was always full. We ordered wine at the bar and the bartender was very friendly.   Price: the meal was very expensive but worth it. We paid a little less than $600 including the tip. I'm all about value so I had to remind myself that the tasting menu was a wonderful experience so I won't complain about the price.   Location: Costa di Mare is located in the Wynn with indoor and outdoor seating. We asked for outdoor seating and sat next to the pond. The hostess said parties of 5 are seated in the cabanas so we were bummed out but our table still had a beautiful view I recommend making a reservation in advance for a table.   Overall, Costi di Mare is good if you're celebrating something special given high prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fancy Italian donuts

_g-QvjeM6R2eg1Y9Bjp1ng.text: Beautiful location inside the Wynn hotel. We were trying to get a quick bites before a show. Antonio took really good care of us. The service was magnificent and the pasta were delicious. My wife ordered Maccheroni and calaramata. Both were cooked to perfection. Must try the roll with truffle. The chocolate almond cake dessert was good but rather overpriced. Definitely will recommend this to all friends.

czl2V2c480FQPdTR3ZEZ7Q.text: This place was absolutely amazing the staff was very knowledgeable informative and made are experience great. The food is top notch verrrrrrryyyyyyy good. We had the lobster or longostin jumbo apps ..we tried the seafood pasta and a regular ricotta pasta they were good and for a main course we had the bass from Italy  that was my favorite fish dish I've ever tried. Great place for our wedding anniversary. Thanks you costa di mare

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful restaurant

6hFsRcsv9WNzukPEaWwuqw.text: The hostess is the face of any restaurant.  Sadly our first experience at this fine restaurant was beyond subpar when it came to how welcome the hostess made us feel.    We had Thursday 5:30 reservations which is when they open.  Two adults and our 5 year old.  I asked for outside dining.  Were we made to wait at least 10 minutes past opening in an empty restaurant while the hostess was in discussions with other employees.  When she finally came to get us no apologies for the extra wait.  She proceeds to sit us inside while the entire outside seating is still empty.    We sit down, but refrain from asking why we are t getting an outside table like we requested.   After a few minutes I ask the waiter.  He says he will take care of it.  10 minutes later the hostess comes back to our table, looks me straight in the eye and says all the outdoor tables are spoken for (meanwhile they are all empty and I'm more than confident by the time we are done eating many of them still will be). I have no words for her and she just says "sorry" and walks away.  Ok now not only do we not feel welcome we are really offended.  We are about to spend a lot of money in this place and it feels like we just got slapped in the face.    Our waiter asked us if we are moving outside and we said "no" we assume the hostess doesn't want us outside because we have a 5 year and perhaps they have a rule about not allowing children outside, but we don't know for sure because hostess doesn't have enough respect for her paying guests to just be honest.  The waiter frowned and shook his head.    To his great credit he apparently said something to the head waiter who promptly moved us outside.  He said "young people just don't get it" and he was right. Just because we had a child doesn't mean we want to stop living.  We still want to go to nice restaurants and not be forced to eat chicken fingers at Denny's all the time.    The wait staff was beyond amazing and made our night.  Needless to say when we left the outside seating was still more than half empty.    The hostess can learn a thing or two from their waiters on how to make guests feel welcome.   Wine was superior.  Food was an 8 out if 10 in terms of flavor and originality.  For the price I'd encourage them to raise the bar on the food if they want True foodies to be repeat customers.

MLXtVi-frfGg6B92QpHevg.text: This was called Bartolatta, when my husband and I came here. Exquisite menu options, and cocktails are incredible. Definitely pricey, but worth your time and money. Luxurious decor, impressive all the way around with magnificent views.   We are looking forward to our visit this September, and can't wait to explore the new menu options and will definitely take lots of pictures and will share with you guys our experience.   I am sure it will not disappoint. Till then...

qSLSQCkYaPa-YFJym9Hc0A.text: We absolutely love Costa since the new Executive Chef took on the task of building a brand. It is definitely our go-to seafood restaurant on the Wynn and Encore properties.   In addition Elion their amazing General Manager does a great job of balancing the front of the house with the back of the house.  The food is amazing. The service is spectacular and the venue, inside our out, is gorgeous.  The finest italian fish restaurant in the city.

P2ivBs7wagl0rvuYzzV8rA.text: Impeccable service and delicious fresh seafood!   The menu is large but purposeful, meant for long sitting meals and would recommend sharing everything from the apps to entrees. Our waiter and chef were sensitive to my dietary restrictions and customized my meal so I could eat everything that everyone else was having - so accommodating! They have gluten-free pasta!   Must try the clam linguine and fresh langoustines!

KIrHmUAU9wqdq_eMMfII4w.text: I loved it here! My family celebrated my dad's new company here and the service could not have been nicer. The only thing that was off about this restaurant was that there was a lady with too much plastic surgery staring at me from the corner of the room. But, that's not the restaurants fault and hey, it's Vegas. All types there. :)

AXqZ6lmeUM1LZ550irNjAw.text: Excellent service and food selection.  Would highly recommend the pasta as it melts in your mouth and very much enjoyed the fish being fileted tableside.  It is always nice to try something new.  We tried the Orata, and enjoyed it very much.  This was a suggestion from our waiter when we told him the types of fish we normally like to have.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

hoQ2Ck-MNHmwL-0oTzdiUA.text: Italian seafood is the name of the game here.   The food was fairly good, and the service was good as well.  The presentation was not great, and the setting did not overwhelm.  The wine list is very good, and the Som is sharp and knowledgeable.  "Ghost Wine" was a great term for old wine that is a shadow/ghost of what it used to be.  I would come back, but not my first choice in Vegas.

bzQhsWf84Oji56305fwWgw.text: I give two stars only because where I sat outside with my dining partner was cozy.  All right, so I am confused by this place...bear with me.  I knew about this place for I was staying at the Wynn, and before I got there I looked at all of the restaurants on line beforehand, and the menus.  I heard we were going there, and I thought "yum.."  The booth/table we sat at was, in fact cozy.  That was nice.  Going down the stairs to the outside terrace was interesting, and I saw glass boxes with fish on ice in a few places on the way down.  We were greeted with a box of fish on ice with brass trim.  Apparently ALL of the fish in there were flown in fresh from Italy that day.  We started there at about 6:30 pm so that was a long ass flight for the fish, and they made it there just in time for us.  Our waiter was from Napoli, he said, and had an accent, and told us all about the fish, and lobster, and crab and whatnot, and pointed to the (and forgive my spelling) the seabring fish that he ate as a kid in Italy, and how tasty it was.  I have since googled said fish, and I cannot find it anywhere..regardless..I tried spelling it in a few ways.   We ordered a scallop appetizer, and it had mushrooms.  It was good.  We each got a scallop.  We then opted for the whole red snapper, which they sell by the gram.  We shared this.  There were choices of sauces to put on the fish, and we got tomato, and green olive "sauce" for the top.  The waiter cut up and de- boned the fish in front of us, and took away the head and bones and all of the skin.  The finished fish on the plate was good, and so was the sauce, and there were potatoes and herbs (I think) on the side.  The meal in and of itself was good.  I have definitely had MUCH better for the prices, and I would have done the sauce differently.  I kept wondering why they threw out the head, and how sometimes, especially in the asian culture, the head goes to the "head" of the family..and people eat the whole thing at times.  I hope that all of that excess fish went to a stock or something later on.  So first of all, I have had better.  Second, I am not sure of all the hype flying fish in daily from Italy.  As another reviewer stated, it did seem a bit pretentious for what it actually was, but I suppose it is Vega$, and you get what you pay for, and I suppose that is my third...Don't you hate it when people say "first" without backing it up with a "second or third?"  Oh yeah, and fourth..what the hell is a seabring fish?  There are better fish places on the planet.  Go to one of those.  I think they mean well, so I do not want to completely bash it.  I had a good time with my dining partner, nevertheless.

uowgokuFxaIzIdxvaTk1Pw.text: My boyfriend and I will never forget our incredible experience sitting at the bar here. We were disappointed they had no more tables, so we have the bar a try, so glad we did. The bartender played many roles, food and drink expert, comedian, delivery man. This guy sent some to get a special kind of tequila for me from another bar in the casino. The food was mind-blowing, baby clams, seafood pasta, we really will never forget it. This is more of a thank you, the food was so damn good.

xvwp4H1R8oiNiF1_9ISGZQ.text: This is a more romantic & subdued restaurant.  The langoustine was fantastic!!  The whole fish, however, left much to be desired because the pesto sauce was just not jiving with the fish.  Service was tip-top.

d2eHVssJWRyt7UflJ9fmbg.text: Service, not good. Food, just ok, but I have had lots better, for a lot less. I would have thought that a nice restaurant with pricey meals would be better. Not so much.

ZVtUd0O-lZoJ03YEeLPnNQ.text: The restaurant itself is gorgeous.  I really enjoyed the outdoor cabana. For the decor and setting, they get 5 stars.  But what disappointed me was the food quality.  They are ok, but the quality really doesn't suit this stunning restaurant and the taste I expected.  Their pasta was so so, their fish dish(bass) was really not good at all.  I would love to go there just to enjoy outdoor canaba and have some drinks & desserts if that is a possible option.  Other than that, I won't be dining there again.

jmPiHqFJCsqRN1vmTr0UPw.text: We were very disappointed.  The food was ok at best.  The menu was limited.  I can't recommend this place.  The wine list was good and the service was good.  The setting is great (everything at the Wynn is nice).

gQLSo_OFMYl5PfTJWqE68g.text: Amazing! if you have ever traveled to Italy and can appreciate fresh, authentic Italian food, you have found the place. Despite the mixed reviews, we decided to try it out and were extremely impressed with the experience. The fish is flown in daily from Italy-we got the branzino cooked in salt-truly melted in our mouths. The gnocchi was awesome and we also got the artichoke and mushroom salad which was also delicious. The chef/owner came by our table and brought over about 12 homemade gelatos to try. They are all made on their premise daily. Flavors:grapefruit, mango, pink grapefruit ices. pistachio, coffee, chocolate, banana, gianduia, rosemary gelatos-each and every flavor was a piece of heaven. Yes, this place is pricey, but well worth every penny. Enjoy!

_mCa4F9tA8gKlVSbVvrijw.text: damn fine food, especially the lagostine and pasta....service was even better....we ate at the bar where Rich and Gustav (sp) put on a clinic on proper bar tending and all round service...even chef bartolotta came by to check on us...

0q_T35Aa3O4dhOtuSlEvvQ.text: After the first course, I threw up.    As a huge Top Chef fan, we went to Bartolotta for the Top Chef tasting menu.  First course consisted of five tapas-sized dishes.  The first was an assortment of "fried" fish which included soft shell crab, calamari and 90% white fish which we didn't care for.  The ocyopus salad was tasty as were the grilled scallops with mushrooms and parmesan.  Canellini beans with bortaga was tasty.  The clams in  wine sauce were metallic tatsting.  I tried two or three and sent them back suggesting the chef check the dish.  The waiter brought the next couse which consisted of sheeps milk cheese ravioli, squid ink risotto, and two types of pasta.  I had a bite of each and mentioned that the pasta was very undercooked.  The response?  "That's the way we cook it here."  My bite of rissoto was good, but all of the sudden I became nauseaus and had to run to the ladies room.  After about 10 minutes, my husband was presented with a bill.  There was no concern, no apology.  After cleaning  up, I spoke with the manager and questioned how he could charge $200.00 for a meal that literally made someone sick. "You think it was the food?" the manager asked.  He ultimately comped the "meal" but charged for wine (even though that was left on the table).  I was sick in my room the next day with symptoms of food poisoning.  Cannot recommend.  Nothing was above average even before I got sick.

mbOMtihESJajG2a75e132A.text: 4 stars or 4 $$$$?  the answer is both.  the crowd was for the most part older and conservative.  but the life of the party was right at the bar and his name was "rich."  why the high costs?  part of the money is for the beautiful view and decor but the coolest cost goes to tracking the fish shipments as they are delivered from the mediterranean.  i like big and bold wines so the i'll borro 05 toscana was just that but the younger 07 dolcetto d'alba was smooth but felt high in tannins.  1. the sauteed clams with tomato sauce, garlic, white wine and parsley was very tasty.  good enough to sop up the broth with bread.  2. the lasganette pasta with lobster, shrimp, white wine and tomato was good but the pasta was sadly overcooked.  3. the fish is always good to share since the portions are large but they do carry a special of the day where they have individual filets.  that night, they carried the gallinella which is similar to a light sole.  unfortunately, the garlic overpowered it.  only the texture from the artichoke and the acidity from the tomato saved the dish.  sadly, there was no time for dessert as we had a show to catch.  sniff.  despite some little misses, the overall experience was just wonderful.

ZGsDwNHmlNp14RzQ_-Pf9Q.text: We found this to be a fantastic restaurant!  Incredible house-made pastas, fresh seafood, and a decent wine selection!    The wait service was attentive, knowledgeable, and respectful. Our water glasses were never empty, and the food was delivered at a very nice pace.  We never felt rushed and truly enjoyed ourselves.   The only drawback to speak of:  opening, looking, and paying for the bill.  I agree with other yelp reviewers that there is very little value; borderline abuse on the wallet!

1cH7UEPmg4PvGQ5AjZ7Eow.text: The service and ambience at this restaurant is fantastic as are the creative drinks. it's also set within a very romantic atmosphere on the strip. The appetizers particularly the cuttlefish were divine. The spaghetti with rock lobster was beautifully done from the texture to the sauce to the lobster. The seafood risotto was missing a little flavor and the seafood in it just didn't pop. The fish was delicious and well prepared but way too pricey and that's the only thing that would probably make me hesitate to go back.

Nm-N1Hl7yeXtGBqkvde9mw.text: Really disappointing.   Extremely expensive and I've had better food at the olive garden.  Service and atmosphere are the only positives.  The bill for my wife and I after tip was $350 and we didn't order dessert.  My wife's seafood risotto was so salty it was almost unedible.

7-lgj6BIjJwyw2fMmybjtQ.text: Great experience! I suggest the patio if the weather permits. Such a nice atmosphere out there. Baked whole fish is there thing but my fav of the night was the lasagnette con ragu di crostacei ("rags" of pasta, lobster, shrimp, crab, white wine, tomato) and the insalata di piovra Ligure (Ligurian octopus salad, olive oil, lemon).

ww5ELZeVNE0yJhHCyR9WWg.text: I loved this place! The waiter Ray was very nice and really seemed to care about making sure we were happy. It wasnt cheap but really felt it was well worth the money!

k8UaLIWBRgJE0AA4cu7Qow.text: Went with a group of 8 and ordered one of the tasting menus.  The food was delicious!  We had a traditional assorted meat plate, cheese ravioli, a whole fish cooked in a salt crust, as well as so many other things, too many to remember.  The staff was amazing and was very knowledgeable.  They were helpful in explaining the food, as well as answering any questions we had, and also provided great plates to a vegetarian in our group.

YDnD8MgqjTAEeJK_QjdIZg.text: A little disappointed.  We did the tasting menu which was okay.  When I reflect on it now the most memorable entrees were the octopus salad and the dessert.

eznclN79H3U9c-0wEcSuMQ.text: One and done!  Sorry but at $180 per person, I anticipated a much better experience.  A group of 5 of us arrived at 8:30 on a Sunday evening.  We were one of four tables in the restaurant.  One might assume you'd get very prompt service with so few patrons... wrong. We had to wait a while for just about everything from water refills, to drink orders, to even getting our menus.  The waiter didnt explain how fish was sold so we were all a bit surprised when we got the check.   The food was average for being so pricey.  (avoid the Rock Lobster spaghetti... its not worth it)   Lastly, the air conditioning or ventilation was very poor because it was very stuffy were we were sat.  Overall, very disappointing experience... not sure how this place has received any 5 star ratings, maybe Sunday nights its tough to get a quality wait staff?

MlJU6PUaqcPDkk1kdQAQDA.text: What a truly wonderful dining experience! My husband and I practice a plant based diet so we were so excited to learn that a vegan menu is offered! Every dish was so unique and flavorful! Presentation is gorgeous and portion sizes are more then fair for the price. Our table was seated next to the window so we had a lovely view of the outside lake with all its koi fish and lovely decor. We had multiple servers (making it a little difficult to remember everyone's names) but Antonio and the manger Alberto were both gems and always appeared at just the right moment to clear, remark, poor water etc without being intrusive. Cannot wait to return when the weather warms up and the patio is open.

yIXU0MLS-J5KPnHmpy90IQ.text: Oh my gosh, don't know where to start. Finding a high-class, romantic atmosphere for dinner in Vegas can be TOUGH -- you either dress down for the day or wait til almost midnight to put on heels. This place is perfect for an anniversary or birthday, whether it's just two of you or in a group. It's definitely pricey, but you get what you pay for -- amazing food (seafood is mostly fresh with an italian twist) and the service was probably the best I've experienced anywhere in the world.   If you / your group is planning drinking, definitely book a cabana outside (it's a $150/person minimum). The view is gorgeous and the atmosphere even cozier. Definitely my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.

QwzKovv2ZD0Crn2dGcUhOA.text: Had a wonderful birthday dinner here! Amazing food and wonderful service. You have to order dessert, it's well worth it!! If your not sure of what type of fish you want talk to your waiter and tell them what you normally like, they will know exactley what to recommend. They had the best most tender octopus I've ever had!!

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. How sweet!

sK-hQSQxnKU_hwENToMu6A.text: Such a great view from the patio.  Delicate fish flow in from Italy with inspired service.  We were shocked with the flavors showcasing freshness complimented with subtle seasoning.  A must have is the dorato and octopus.   Will be back soon

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle season
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great view and nice start to our evening

G90yZsh3kUQ6XiMjzeANWQ.text: If this were a 1-10 scale, we'd give it a 10. Impeccable service, lovely restaurant. Had cocktails at the small bar first, where the bartender was friendly and accommodating. We highly recommend the Branzino (Mediterranean Sea Bass)-firm, moist and perfectly seasoned. Really wonderful experience.

SKm_x0k4Tc-UzfgbJDuC9w.text: We sat at the bar because it was so full and we just wanted to try a few appetizers. They were great and gave us full meal service and we had amazing service and food! The scallops were to die for and the meat sauce homemade pasta was epic!

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

fJfUuERjyud3_sASuQEaJw.text: Exquisite fish and Italian cuisine. Came here for an anniversary. I can't say enough about the detail of the decor, atmosphere, and plates. Fresh fish caught daily and shipped to the restaurant. You can select from an array of fish and have it cooked to your liking. A must try: appetizer octopus in olive oil and the Bolognese pasta. Flavor and texture are made to perfection. They even brought us a surprise house  desert for our anniversary! I love staying at the Wynn and eating in there restaurants because of the amazing attention to detail. Excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

2pU0o0Qxt0sTC6NfzR9YIA.text: I still really enjoy the food here, but, after having enjoyed many other high end restaurants in Vegas, I feel my money is better spent elsewhere.  Particularly as I don't love the delicate nuances of fish and can't really enjoy the pastas (blasted carbs!), it's likely that we won't have too many more visits here.  The octopus salad and sea scallops stand out as being very tasty.  As always, good service, nice atmosphere, and great wine list.    If you love fish, then you must go here; for me, I love what Chef Bartolotta is doing here, but it's not my preference for dinner.

LWMHjWpuKM64-GyOj5Uuwg.text: Food, perfect (pagello... pink snapper); wine, perfect (Pinot Nero); appetizers, perfect (cappesante d orate con porcini, insalata di piovra Ligure), dessert: coppa di mascarpone, perfect; ambience, a wonder; service: personalized *and* perfect.  I've been to over a 1,000 restaurants, and it would be hard to quantify, but this was the perfect dining experience.  Go and enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our waiter, a peach of a guy
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Upstairs dining room, windows to right out of frame

WNAMApn56PmQXncy0y1Blg.text: Over cook scallops, no taste food ! But good design and service very attentive! Place only for drinks !!!! ((((

CmHp4RlFZ_94j5ZYzUlMmA.text: Beware of the whole fish menu, they charge by the hundred grams! Our whole Branzino, which yielded 2 small fillets, cost us $128! Also, don't order "a glass of Prosecco" like I did. That was $29. I had 2 glasses and had quite a shock looking at our check. Our Branzino was overcooked. The fried tiny fish appetizer tasted fishy. This restaurant is for people who don't need to concern themselves with how much things cost. The bill bummed us out :(

4gA_1ZAAJNik-ZvSkznlJA.text: Let's go with the good, the bad, and the ugly.  First off, here's the good:  Now here's the bad: The service was pretty poor. For an upscale restaurant, the waiter seamed flustered, rushed, and at times confused. He forgot to bring us the menu. He didn't bring the fish over for display like they are supposed to at this restaurant. And he seamed to forget just about everything we asked for.  And finally the ugly: We ordered Bravo's Top Chef tasting menu. I'm sad to say that most of the items lacked flavor and were very unimpressive. Without going into too much detail, it was a waste of my time.  I wouldn't recommend this restaurant. There are so many better out there.

Q6JsiI_yrCj5mFEgpwiVfQ.text: This is by far the very best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas . If you want an upscale , exceptional dinner book your table there . The decor is sublime with a spiral staircase that leads you into a room with a spectacular chandelier and room opens  into a patio with a very romantic pond ... The service is royal and the food is beyond anything you have had before . The seafood is freshly imported from Italy and you will find there an array of fish like trilla , live langoustines , live slipper lobsters , fresh red Spanish shrimps called carabineros , the pasta are fresh and home made and the service is extremely attentive to your needs ...   we always request  Maurizio . He's the best !! We choose him to wait on us for his great  personality , he's funny , attentive and prompt and can not wait to impress you with his service and attention which is remarkable nowadays ...  we travel miles to dine there and an evening  without him is absolutely not the same ...

K3MPzH6UgGY9kLvNGC-Bug.text: We had another good meal at Bartolotta but the prices are getting out of control.  Now don't get me wrong, I go to expensive places a lot.  We went to Cut also on this trip.  Bartolotta's prices are on the high side for fining dining and if you are not seriously into fish there are other higher on my list.

cMT-RB0K8dM7dUpJU33rug.text: If you dine here and don't mind paying the premium, it is amongst the best restaurants I've ever eaten at. I'm not one to write reviews ever, but this place rules

h3HHFqxhe9lIOJx9zchN0Q.text: The food was excellent!!!! I had a shrimp pasta with tomato sauce which was the best I ever had. The service is high end. We went for our engagement celebration and they brought us a dessert on the house congratulating us. I recommend you can make rvsp and come early to get a seat next to the beautiful pond they have outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Pasta with tomato sauce (normally comes with mushrooms but we paid extra for get the shrimps)

2acMop4oFYmIrKn1htOSxg.text: The food here is okay, but definitely more on the pricey side for okay food. I had the risotto ai frutti di mare, which is a seafood entree that consist of scallops, shrimp, lobster, clams, crab, cuttlefish, and octopus. I also tried the brodetto di pesce all'Abruzzese, which was about $60 and I liked it better than the risotto frutti, but still it was nothing special for that price. It was good, but it wasn't special or unique in anyway. Pretty much I had better tasting Italian food for half the price. I do understand that this is a high end Italian restaurant in the Wynn, so you will have to pay more. I am fine with that, but everything here is just okay.  The restaurant is really nice and the service was exceptional. I would probably come back here in the future, but I am going to try something else.

2hchU30kiZJaMu83A_V4MA.text: This was the most over priced disaster of a meal I have ever had. I went with a friend and I ordered a salad which I requested the dressing on the side. The waiter pushed me to keep the dressing on as he stated it was a lite dressing. I told him I don't eat oil. I ordered steam vegetables and 2 large red shrimp for $30 each.  The salad came drenched in heavy dressing mixed with Parmesan cheese throughout. I didn't want to complain and be embarrassed so I ate it. It was incredibly heavy. Then came what only can be described as large red Roaches on a plate drenched in some weird red oil. The actual edible part ( if you can say that) was no bigger than a normal large shrimp, not even a jumbo shrimp. Then when I ate it, it was gushy and tasted like I was eating raw shrimp. Gross!!!!  I complained at this point to the manager. Who did take the meal off my bill. I tried to explain to the waiter that when someone orders a salad with dressing on the side or food without oil that he should not argue with a customer and just take the order. I felt like it was falling on deaf ears so I tried to tell the manager. It wasn't just about the outrageous price but the fact the food was not prepared how I ordered it and that the waiter should not improvise on what a client wants. Again I felt it fell on deaf ears. So beware! Eat somewhere else!!

IUYPg8Z1K3T7t25da8F04Q.text: Great food!  Great ambiance!  Great service! The seafood is very fresh.  The homemade pasta dishes were perfect

2jMYsupycEZwYdYs1iSM2g.text: Very nice. I came here with several friends, who had heard from others that this is a must try place on the Strip. Happy to report that they were right. It is a bit pricy, but the food quality is very good, and they fly all of their seafood over daily from Italy, which is probably no small feat.  Even though their roasted fish seems wonderful, I wasn't quite in the mood for that, and went with their grilled octopus as an appetizer (delicious, soft octopus, grilled perfectly) and followed with their house made fresh spaghettini with shrimp, scallops, small lobsters, clams and a lovely tomato / garlic sauce. I savored every bite. You can order these as "entree size" if you want. Honestly, I could have eaten even more, but alas - I did not want to be rude. I rounded out the meal with an espresso and their tiramisu, which was wonderful. So many places have bland, flavorless tiramisu, but not this place! The tiramisu was fluffy and flavorful - perfect to round out the meal.  Overall, a good place to keep on your short list when in Vegas. Less outrageous than the big celebrity chef places, and with excellent quality of ingredients. Would definitely return to enjoy this place again, since they were so friendly, professional, and skilled. Grazie!!

PEDVFJxYRgrPCZ8EHoJH7w.text: Save your money. We spent close to $200 and it wasn't worth it.   We ordered the pellegrino, Fiji water ($9.50 each), fiore di zucca, black ink pasta, pappardelle porcini, agnolotti (not burrata raviolis), seafood soup, artichoke salad, risotto and the best stuff there was free!  The breads and the lemon ricotta butter were outstanding. The pappardelle was the worst I have ever had. They didn't even bother making the pasta thin, just thick chunky sheets. Who does that???  The seafood soup was bland, risotto was undercooked, the salad was bitter and unpalatable.  The squid ink pasta was the best and the zucchini.   The raviolis I blame entirely on the awful awful waiter. He didn't explain to us that it wasn't burrata in the traditional sense or that the pasta was also thick skinned.   I've never met anyone so pretentious! Short, bald and pot-bellied. First he came by speaking Italian, "Prego?" Without any desire to interpret or be charming. Thankfully I understood him unlike our neighbors. I think he only says this to humiliate who he thinks are unrefined! He started with telling us a story of the restaurant and pulled out a showcase of seafood. I did notice that he didn't do it for everyone. Only those who he thought would order from the extremely expensive choices. He didn't pull out the showcase for our neighbors for example. He NEVER returned at any point in the dinner to ask us how our dinner was or if we needed anything. Not even to deliver the bill! Best part as we were leaving, he pretended not to see us so he didn't have to say goodbye.   The only reason I'm not giving this review a harsher rating is due to one of the hosts: Ivo. What an exquisite human being. He sat us at a special table facing out and big enough for 4 people. He came downstairs to check on us 3 times! What host does that? He also served the free birthday lemon dessert himself with charm and kindness that you would expect from an establishment like this. The other wait staff were also genuinely wonderful. One individual actually sent us home with extra lemon ricotta just because he knew we liked it. Another got our bill because our waiter was too "busy" with other people.   By the way, don't go there with slippers. They won't seat you.   I won't return ever except maybe to say hi to Ivo.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free Biscotti after meal
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Risotto, undercooked
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Squid ink pasta

5VZSDKrwmAydmEMLlA4IBQ.text: This maybe an unfair review as we didn't sample the seafood offerings which they are known for -Mediterranean Sea to Costa di Mare table in 40hrs..!  So I'll comment on the rest..  (I'm gonna have to apologize upfront as I can't remember the names of the dishes)  So we had a salad or two and some pasta dishes.. all in all, sub par compared to what you would expect for the price you pay..   Oh and a starter, Fiore de Zucca which I think was under the salad section.. (it's fried veg with ricotta in a gram flour batter.... oh what a delight it was)!  The risotto - was ok  The squid ink pasta - now that was definitely worth the money!  Also.. they offer home made ricotta in olive oil, on the house... now this was amazing.. possibly the best ricotta a man can have.. smooth, tasty, oh man it was so good.. so good that we even got two extra servings to take out!   This place was posh.. overpriced..

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh yuk - this was a buratta pasta dish of some kind - don&#39;t order it!! Don&#39;t!
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t waste your money on this dish.. something porcini.. we took like a bite eat.. really disappointing
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscotti - freebie - but careful not to break your teeth on these things! and that blob of jelly is strawberry basil, i think

1sgwJdAwc8Mun5dkG7EI0Q.text: I went here last night to celebrate a birthday with my two best friends. We made a reservation and asked to be seated outside right by the beautiful pond. If you want to be seated outside, then you can only make a reservation for either 6:30pm or 9:30pm. Also it's a $150 minimum per person.   The drinks were extremely good! Had a nice kick to them without actually tasting too much alcohol. Cocktails were all about $22 each. Wine was over priced except for the dessert wines. Our waiter had a thick Italian accent that was difficult for us to understand. He came over and explained all of the fish and how it is flown in from Italy daily.   We all chose one to two appetizers each, and then chose an appetizer pasta as our main dish. Dishes are small for the price, but they were all appetizer sizes. The food was good but nothing over the top to wow you. I think you are mostly just paying for the view. I definitely wouldn't recommend taking someone here that doesn't like seafood. I would return again.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood pasta appetizer
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raw appetizer
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NaxMYhP1hYP4FS2eMHSXFQ.text: Definitely some of the best Italian I've had in Vegas. It is pricey but everything now in Vegas is, so I guess there's that. The bill came to 425 for 3 people and no one ordered drinks. The sea bass was cooked perfectly! The grilled octopus was fantastic. Definitely would recommend the wilted arugula salad and sheep's milk ravioli.

xdXR7YIKb1Xoeq0iC4SvHA.text: Most delicious, fancy dinner at Costa di Mare at the Wynn. We dined outside next to a luxurious pool of water with a gentle mist. My main course was the porcini mushroom risotto, which was absolutely amazing. I savored every morsel. My appetizer was a warm artichoke heart, porcini mushroom, and arugula salad, which was simple, but so delicious. Our little teaser at the beginning of the meal was a melon, tomato, and almond salad, which was also so good. The Wynn knows how to do vegan fine dining right.  Be warned: you will be spending a pretty penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arugula salad with fresh artichokes.
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom risotto, vegan and gluten free.
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor dining at its finest.

IYOud3MCnbctYa7zO9VxrA.text: Had super high expectations for this place.  I was slightly disappointed especially with how small the portions were.  I know it's Vegas and there's some Vegas prices incorporated but just got wish they gave alittle more fish.    The fish was definitely fresh and they show it to you.  I would come back next time now I know what to expect.  They serve langostine which not places serve!

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States

raAFySroKVVLrdGaBqXKog.text: One of our favorite places to visit while in LV. Albeit pricy (be aware that an Aperol Spritz comes with at $25 price tag at the bar) yet the food and service are amazing.   The fish is flown in fresh from Europe and the atmosphere is fantastic! Their truffle bread rolls are amazing and (if you like fish), the dishes are prepared with great care.   It'a a place worth checking out! Sitting outside makes the experience even more special.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh fish from Italy

LmwhmRxN-X59Qt9WXaUOeQ.text: First of all very complicated menu , very tricky , main dish price not like you see , second - service very bad - we wait vine bottles like 30 min , seat outside you can't take even if you make reservations-outside only by phone, food not bad but not any special,  very simply. All over for this price 1 star. Wr came for our friend 50th birthday and were very disappointed. We will NOT recommend this place , you can find better restaurants in Wynn and Encore.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iuoK3xQwUiIXkmr_IUq1kA.text: One of the best meals I've had! Beautiful ambiance, the food was delicious, and the service was impeccable!!   Had the sea bass, different pasta dishes, and Pinor Nior. All were fantastic and the service went above and beyond!! A +  Would go back next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PqsO8aTYAW6BBCUaxrmcbA.text: What an amazing experience. My husband and I got married and went to celebrate at Costa and it was just out of this world.  Perfect food Perfect waiters  Perfect Hosts  Perfect experience  With a great view  Drinks were great too Didn't think it was pricy at all. You pay for the wonderful experience. And I don't regret a dime spent on that wonderful day.

S35KEqiD9-XcJzMu8TBt-w.text: I made our reservation via phone SIX months in advance as we were celebrating our Anniversary and I wanted to make sure we were sat outside around the cool pond.  When we made reservation there was no mention of a price minimum.  On the morning of our reservation we received a confirmation call and then were informed of the $150 pp minimum.  Not that it is difficult to achieve, I felt that should have been communicated at the time of reservation.    When we arrived, we were not placed outside but at a table inside next to a window overlooking the outside!!!  If the restaurant had been busy, that would have been one thing but there was only one couple seated outside!!  I was very disappointed and displeased.  The meal... not worth the price!  I started off with the extra large langoustine for $35.  That gave me four tiny bites.  It was very flavorful but not worth the price.  It was like an amuse bouche. My husband had the assorted fried Mediterranean fish.  It was several whole fried mini fish.  He didn't care for this as the bones made it difficult to eat.  Next I had the garganelli freschi al ragu di crostacei and it was delish!!!  I just was I had twice as much!!!   Husband had the Risotto ai frutti di mare and he thought it was very good.    Now for the reason to visit!!  The fish flown in daily!!!  We chose the gilt head sea breem fish.  While it was very tasty, it was not worth the price.    We skipped desert as nothing appealed to us on the menu.  However, being our Anniversary, they did surprise us with a small plate of Flan.  Would we visit again or recommend??? No.  This is an experience restaurant and not such a great one that we would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gilt Head Sea Breem Fish
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extra Large Langoustine.
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gilt head Sea Breem Fish

tiM2_kEQV6ucXFU_TC80ww.text: So I just left this restaurant...my wife made reservations two weeks in advance it's our Anniversary we thought we would like this place as we own an Italian restaurant and love real Italian food...the food was fantastic however the service was awful, I feel I was really looked down upon and have never ever been treated that way in a restaurant....we were seated in an awful table while there were plenty of nice tables with a view open when we arrived but no right in the middle of the dining room...and on top of that the servers would hardly even come to the table I was not offered an after dinner drink something I always partake in and it was simply mediocre at best I can't believe how bad the service actually was at a place dinner is 60  Just felt like updating....we reached out to the email provided to us by the guest relations response and they never called...apparently we just weren't important enough for them to be bothered with...we have been going to Vegas every year for our anniversary for the past 4-5 and plan to continue as we have a home in Arizona and will never come here or the Wynn again

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1_IxfblJgN5FCj5Qpcpbww.text: Nice atmosphere and service. However, food is so so, and one particular dish is not fresh. For this kind of price, I expect much better food quality.  When I were able to walk-in and get a table right the way on Saturday 8pm during EDC weekend, I started to worry. I can see the restaurant is half full only.   We ordered the food anyway. We had the grill octopus, fresh sea urchin, seared scallops, fried softshell crab and lobster spaghetti.  1st of all, all dishes tasted kinda plain, nothing really excite your taste bud. 2nd, see urchin is not fresh and had stomachache/light diarrhea after the meal.  I'll not come back and don't recommend it to anyone.

o1p_qKYuBuHK4tJAybbHfg.text: Dined at Casta Di Mare at Wynn a coastal Italian restaurant that flies in fresh fish daily! We had a beautiful window seat overlooking the koi fish pond. I can't rave about the spot enough. Everything from the black truffle rolls, grilled octopus, scallops on fig jam, fresh made pasta with rock lobster  ALL incredible. We shared the #orata baked to order and filleted table side. Topped off the night with a 20 year port, biscotti trio and vanilla lemon cake for the birthday boy!  we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscotti complimentary
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orata

qh65c-E7wzBVw2psSRqcUw.text: The best thing was the bread service... which speaks a lot about a restaurant. Zero flavor, bland, and service was so slow.... will never come again!

egUgF2dfUT13DG1Wm3SQ2g.text: My boyfriend and I came here last summer and fell in love with this restaurant. We've now dined here over 10 times. The food is amazing and the service is impeccable. The restaurant itself is beautiful, no matter where you're seated the view is amazing. The first time we ate here we were seated at the outside seating by a lagoon with koi fish. And it was so pretty and very romantic. I would definitely recommend requesting the outdoor seating if you're doing the tasting menu, since you'll be there for at least a couple hours. The tasting menu is great if it's you're first time dining here since you can try a little bit of everything on the menu. It's a lot of food but worth it! Most of the time we come in for a quick dinner and we sit at the bar. The bartenders are very nice and attentive. My favorite pastas are the linguine and clams or the Spaghetti All'astice. They're served in appetizers portions but can be ordered in an entree size. My boyfriend always orders the Fisherman's Stew which has big pieces of lobster, scallops, shrimp, clams and seafood. He's also ordered the filet in Sangiovese wine sauce and loved it. We also love the whole branzino that they prepare for you tableside. For dessert we always do the sorbet and gelato assortment. Our favorites are the banana caramel and salted caramel gelato and the mango and coconut sorbet. Then we always get the tiramisu and the Bomboloni. The Bomboloni is like a fried donut filled with a custard. Depending on the season there's an apple (fall/ winter) or blueberry (spring/summer)compote. The tiramisu here is very light and not too heavy. Even when we order these desserts to go they pack it so perfectly as if we're eating it in the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Branzino- the sauce and tomatoes are amazing
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Spaghetti
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam Appetizer

MEo4GLhuC2-AouMBm4dJbw.text: OVERPRICED FOOD It was 7pm and the restaurant was nearly empty, I should have been concerned. I wanted to dine somewhere special and delicious to celebrate my 26th anniversary.  I choose this restaurant because I was staying at the hotel and the ambiance looked nice. The menu in my opinion is very limited and it was extremely pricey.  I ordered 1 langoustine, it was about 4 bites and was $40. Although delicious $40 was excessively expensive.  Also the fish my husband ordered was $160! It was baked very simple and you could choose the sauce.  My husband chose tomatoe sauce. The flavor did not wow us in any way. We were both very disappointed.  We also ordered a seafood pasta appetizer the flavor was good but the pasta was very al dente. The cocktails were good.  For the prices they charge you would think you get a basket of bread for the table but they offer a tray selection and you get to choose 1 bread. Every 30 minutes or so they return and offer another.  During my dining I was offered bread 2 times.  Dinner ended up costing $360 for 2 people, which I wouldn't have minded if the portions were decent and everything was amazing.  I would not dine at this restaurant again.  Too overpriced for what you get and the entree menu selection is very limited.  I highly recommend you go somewhere else!

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood pasta appetizer
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $160 whole fish
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $22 each cocktails

5Zcpq2nYMG1DICbXUrnh0Q.text: This is a beautiful restaurant in the Wynn casino with gorgeous lagoon views and bold bright colored decor in the main dining room. You can reserve one of their fancy cabanas for a romantic dinner, which comes with a minimum $150 per person spend.   The restaurant allows kids 5 and over. We did wish to dine in the private cabana but were told that the $150 per person charge applied to kids too :(  So preferred to sit inside, which was awesome! They were pretty busy for a Monday evening.  I was impressed by the assortment of bread, which included their famous truffle bread, to die for!! This was served with house made ricotta cheese, so yumm!! They offer vegetarian and vegan menu which was a blessing for me.   We started with their appetizer pasta, ravioli with Marsala wine glaze, pappardelle with porcini mushrooms,  gnocchi with morel mushrooms and vegan minestrone soup. Everything tasted great was served perfectly hot.  Hubby tried chef special sea bass which was excellent.   The wine selection seemed overpriced, by the glass as well as bottle. Wines that you can get in Costco for under $20, were almost $100!!   I wish they were better staffed. Our server was great but was so busy, the main dining room had maybe 2 servers? He had so many tables, he barely got a chance to check on us. We ordered a bottle of wine but had to pour it ourselves coz he was so busy.   Do not miss dessert! Their Tiramisu is a must try. We paired it with a 20 year old port, a match made in heaven!! My kids tired the assortment of gelato and sorbet which they loved.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assortment of gelato and sorbet

Vx5wooBPcyr39iXavtTZmQ.text: I loved that this place had a separate menu for vegetarian and vegan options. The decor here was lovely.   The drinks here were delicious and uniquely paired. The drink I got had a little bit of tomatoes in it and didn't taste like a Bloody Mary. I loved it!    The bread here was incredible. The Parmesan bread had some olives in it and the truffle oil bread was on point.   The appetizer we got was the chickpea break with lemon in it. It was delicious but a little dry and could've used a sauce.   The spaghetti pomodoro was great and really fresh.    I do think the dishes here were a little pricy for what you were receiving.   Service was great though!

6zMp8ljHkH3hhQmNat7EZw.text: absolutely loved this place.  my favorite place in vegas, in the top 5 of the whole united states.  only place i definitely prefer to it would be manresa in los gatos.  we ordered a la carte one appetizer and three pasta dishes per couple and were absolutely stuffed by the end.  we also all shared a  $70 bottle of light red wine that perfectly complemented the meal.  i thought the service was warmer, friendlier, and more effective even than alex.

eK0SmJYj2bvH4qNHDv_b1Q.text: I recently dined at Bartolotta during my stay at the Wynn this past weekend. We had scheduled a reservation well in advance and in spite of some of the reviews on the poor service I was very optimistic.  It was beautifully decorated and the outside cabanas were gorgeous. We had a party of 8 and did not have to wait long for our table which was perfect. We were greeted right away by the somelier and presented with a 59 page binder of their wine list. The restaurant was extremely crowded and the entire dinner took more than 3 hours. There was such a long pause between the appetizer and main entree course that everyone was becomming wrestless and by the time the entree arrived everyone was just over it. My boyfriend and I ordered the Seafood Risotto and Ricotta Ravioli appetizers  which were fantastic! I then ordered an arugula salad with pancetta and balsamic vinegar. I thought it was so so and found the pancetta a bit tough.  Three of us decided to split the fish entree and had it served tableside with a lemon, olive oil and  garlic, marinade. Our waiter did a fabulous job deboning the fish and serving it to the three of us. This was probably one of the best points of our dinner.  I found this restaurant to be upscale Italian and not for everyone. I witnessed a party of 10 men come in, be seated, look at the menu and then get up to walk out. I did enjoy the food overall and had we not had such poor service I probably would have given it 4 or 5 stars.

7Z19gE2ezz5feoJHQumIJA.text: Loved this restaurant, food was outstanding, expensive , but that is too be expected. Great Italian vine selection. Our waiter Maurizio, was from Rome and was very charming, welcoming and extremely helpful: he explained the menu and suggested the wine to go with our food. Five stars to Maurizio and Bartolotta!

ZmGsltmZZcncfEBgVXN4UQ.text: Visiting the hotel for cocktails at Blush with our compatriots at the Signature Travel Show, we decided to make prior reservations at Bartolotta based on some research one of our Italian specialists did.  We were seated outside near the pool with our party of 5 and the massive wine list.  We finally had to flag down our waiter to provide us with food menus as we had already had our cocktails and were ready to choose a wine based on the fish we were going to select.  We were then treated to view the fresh fish flown in from the Med and 3 of our group decided to split the Turbot.  We all had different appetizers and I had tiny clams in a broth that were so tasty I used several pieces of the bread (there were two kinds and very plentiful) to sop up the juice.  I then had an appetizer portion of the Lasagnette of Pasta, Lobster, Shrimp, Crab, White Wine, and Tomato and again, was thrilled at the flavors and delicacy of the dish.  Wine choices were wonderful and the sommelier spent some time with us and was knowledgable and delightful at the same time.  Dessert was not a high point and you could have knocked me over with a feather when out bill came!  Having dined the previous evening at Emeril's (another story, and not so good) we knew that we would be paying for those James Beard Award points, but whew - make sure your next paycheck in unencumbered!

d8qohH80M-znaNfHEk3nKw.text: Horribly horrible. I live in Santa Barbara, Ca where there are many fantastic restaurants, Italian included. Bartolotta is junk. I ate with my wife who doesn't like seafood. That was not a big deal until the waiter explained to us that all the fresh fish is sold by the whole fish. There was only one fish that they would do for 1 person. The smallest fish they had that night would have cost me $115! I started with the Parmigiano-Reggiano custard with sauteed mushrooms, quite nice, a savory dish. The I had shrimp raviolis, bad, boring and tasted no better than store bought raviolis. My main was a snapper. It was quite nice but nothing over a 3 star, average as average gets. My wife had gnocchi in a tomato cream sauce which was just average again. Now so many people are giving the place 5 stars and I have no idea why. Yes, it is no olive garden and clearly would be 5 stars compared to that, but when you try to compare this restaurant to the best Italian places in the US (like Wynn sells it as) it fails to even come close. There has to be better places to go. I wish I could suggest somewhere else but I just haven't been in Vegas enough to do so.

u1ebBFhtI_IzMjRhl0QMPA.text: Nice looking restaurant - sat indoors.  The waiter shows all the fresh fish that can be ordered.  My favorites were the appetizers - the Octopus Salad and pasta with seafood.  The octopus was flown in and very tender (prepared with olive oil).  We shared the sea bass - which was quite pricey at $135 - was pretty good - but not sure it was worth the money.  Overall, a good experience with great appetizers.  I do knock off a star because the fish was not great (given its price).

wYSdcSpe8dmU678E-ISA-g.text: I'm not going to be nice. The only reason for the 3 stars is service, gnocchi, me dad loved his meal... maybe I should give 4 stars but I just can't. This place is very pretentious. I would never venture in here without my dad, or somebody equally knowledgeable/ slash wealthy. I don't want to go back, but I would not turn down if someone else was paying. We had a wonderful table looking over the rest of the diners and then of course the beautiful windows, but that is despite the point. Drinks.. once again my signature roy rogers, my dad stella. I do not remember if the served bread, nevertheless lets get on to the meal. Gnocchi. oh man their gnocchi is the only reason I would spend money here again. Wow.. everyone must try their fabulous gnocchi. I do not remember what my dad got, but he was pleased. Next I had the lobster. How can you go wrong with lobster... you can. First it was like $60 per ounce or whatever is is they weigh lobster with. I say this is fine and order. You have to order at least 4 of those $60 per... that is $200 my plate alone. ya. if I would of known this ahead of time I would of chose much much differently. I received the ridiculous amount of lobster. had a bite and ugh. NO no no no. I ate it cause I felt bad. I ate $200 lobster because I felt bad. What! that is so wrong. My dad can afford it but I'm a college student. I spend $200 on groceries like a month. Ya needless to say I should of had something else. I'm just so glad I didnt get sick. Our meal was ridiculously overpriced, but my company was good and he loved his meal. For that alone 3 stars.

voscAyIv0dnm0XvdP83XEA.text: I have never been more disrespected at a restaurant like this place! My husband and I were taking a walk, came across Bartolotta and decided to go in. We were seated outside over the pool which was nice but it was chilly out, the waitress assured me there were heaters so I sat closer to one so I won't be cold. Well once a group of men came to sit at the table next to me the waitress decided to shut the heat off with out asking us if it was alright and then when I asked y it was turn off her response was well they don't want the heat. Um excuse me is my money not as green as there's?? Shouldn't I have been asked if it was alright to shut it considering I was there first? NO these guys were high rollers and the staff was bending over back wards for them with out putting into consideration the surrounding tables. Then the waitress asked if I wanted her shawl... I was like no way! Then some one else asked if we would change out seats meanwhile our food was right behind them, I said no again. We order a half bottle of wine which was $40 because the full bottles were over priced. We proceeded with a pasta dish with sea food it was tasty but not worth $58 and then we had ordered a fish to split with some sides ONE Mediterranean Branzino $120, I was shocked and then dessert which tasted old to me. In conclusion, I will never be returning to this place again. Overpriced is not the word for an alright meal and rude staff. Don't waste your time.

mC299F6ZzU721ZAYnfVImw.text: We chose this restaurant after reading up on all Encore/Wynn had to offer because of the scenery (private cabanas by the lagoon!) and the italian seafood fare. They were doing a special "Taste of Wynn" menu when we got there that included an appetizer, entree, and dessert for $69/person which is an incredible deal for this place. We had reservations for when they opened at 5:30 because our show started at 7 (Le Reve). We got there early to secure our cabana and they didn't seat us until about 10 minutes after 5:30 (even though we were the first ones). We easily chose our courses and wine, our apps came out right away  and were fantastic (grilled calamari and cheese ravioli). The entrees took FOREVER to get there. It was about 6:15 when they finally came. I was sad to say that I didn't enjoy my selection (scorpion fish in a white wine sauce) and the waiter offered to switch it out for me. We told him that was not necessary because we couldn't wait for another entree to come out after this took so long and we didn't want to be late for our show. He came back a couple minutes later and said he would have my new dish out in 5 minutes and he delivered. So I ended up with the filet  and loved every bite of it. Hubby had the seafood stew (which I sampled as well) and it was fantastic, lots of different seafood from fish, scallops, shrimp, clams, and a very tasty sauce. They couldn't get our desserts out in time and we ended up having to hurry to the show and barely made it in time. I was incredibly happy with our server, but the kitchen really was on the slow side. The atmosphere is unparalleled, but you're paying for it. Expect this to set you back a little, but it is a great experience overall.

5AwTlPIS11bKeEM_bmLZbw.text: Pricey menu but the food overall is spectacular. The beef tartare is a MUST try.  It is so unbelievably finely chopped--I can't believe it's not butter! Skip the sheep's milk ricotta ravoli (too "goaty" smelling in my opinion) and opt for the Lasagnette Con Ragu Di Crostacei recommended instead. Can't pronounce it? Just point to it! =)  Just don't let the name prevent you from ordering this dish. The homemade pasta is superb; it just melts in your mouth and makes you not ever want to eat pasta al dente ever again. The flavors of lobster, crab, and shrimp are balanced perfectly and are not overpowering. Pairing this dish with a glass of Kerner made for a heavenly culinary experience.

cGP3DKMJGmPJNb-jFzyP3A.text: The food was excellent but the service was simply bad. From a restaurant of this magnitude you would expect much better service. The sommelier was bringing the wine list pushing to make a wine selection at the same time the waiter went over the different kinds of fish. The overall service was slow and not paying a lot of attention to the table. I actually had to get up myself to refill my wine glass a couple of times. The waiters would clean part of the table but then would not return for 15-20 min to clean the rest of the table. If you don't care for good service much and just want to have good food, this is a perfect place for you.

yr_7IeOPWdXrO4gyvEfG2w.text: Solid food, and a really fun waiter made my experience at Bartolotta a great one. This food did not blow me away, but it made me very happy. We began by sharing a bunch of apps. The duck liver pate with white truffles was tasty, as was the beef tar tare (not particularly memorable, but not bad). The menu is all about the fresh fish, which is presented to you ala Morton's steak cart... it's rolled over on a bed of ice. They charge by the gram. Come on... we're in America here, at least put friggin ounces on the menu. I have no idea what 300grams of fish looks like, and I'm not an idiot, I just never measure my cuts of protein in grams. Anyway, as I typically do in places where everything looks amazing, I let the chef select what to cook for me, which ended up being snapper in a wine broth with tomatoes and artichokes. It was light, simple, delicate, and just what I wanted. I would not bust my butt to come back or to bring a friend here, there's just too many outstanding places in Vegas that charge $50-60 a plate to go to before here.

XYXaKF92uasOoXk2rrAQdA.text: "Disappointed" sums up the overall experience at Bartolotta, especially given the overall hype. The location was beautiful and the service was also phenomenal, but the food overall was not up to par. We tried the "Top Chef" tasting menu, which our waiter boasted as being the "best in the world." Unfortunately the flavors did not back up his braggadocio. The seafood was extremely fresh, all the way from the langoustines to the scallops, the lobster, branzino (Mediterranean sea bass), and was cooked just right. However, the dishes were surprisingly bland in terms of flavor, especially for an ultra-high-end Italian restaurant. We had dinner at Twist the night before, and I have to say that Twist's tasting menu was substantially better overall. We really wanted to enjoy this place as we love Italian food, and whereas the food was still good overall, it was not up to the level that we expected given the hype and presentation.

xZ5VGpKKusUUjGrdsHHqRw.text: Overall a superb experience.  I'm surprised by all the complaints about service, but if you come here and order grey goose and cranberry they will treat you accordingly.  Dinner for two came out to a pricey $650, started with negronis to drink, frittura mista to eat, then a massive tasting menu that lasted hours.  Waiters were super friendly native Italians, hilarious, warm, and chatty, with superb knowledge and strong opinions of the various aperitifs and digestifs

IX2jQOYGkYWh1aXkaG-grw.text: I can't believe this restaurant is still in business. My friend  & I had dinner ONCE and that was more than enough.  My food was very mediocre but my friend's was soooo wrong. He ordered the grilled  calamari appetizer, instead he got a very small plate of mostly little shrimp and 3 pieces of calamari  that did not have much flavor. We've had grilled calamari several times before at other restaurants and it is delicious!  When we told the waiter about it he insisted , that is the calamari appetizer????? I stated that there is no mention of  shrimp on the menu regarding this particular appetizer, but he, again said that is the way this appetizer is, I could not belive that this waiter was actually arguing with us !!!!!!     I have dined in some of the best restaurant all over the world, Paris, Rome, Venice, Florence, all over Southern France & never experienced anything like this.  Needless to say we NEVER went back & I tell everyone I meet about this experience because I do not want them to have the same BAD experience we had.

s7vjhYchyOj7g1SDRkJdqQ.text: My mom and I had a girl's weekend last week and she was kind enough to take me to Bartolotta.  A foodie friend familiar with all hot spots in Vegas recommended it, and II read many reviews on Yelp before we went.  I had very high expectations about this place and told the waiter this right off the bat.  I was not disappointed.  Neither mom nor I was interested in the dead fish tray.  I wanted to want the fish but it did not appeal.  We started with the Ligurian octopus salad, which was excellent.  If it weren't for the glowing reviews on Yelp I woulnd not have ordered it.   So thank you to everyone out there who takes the time to write these reviews.  Then we had the scallops on the bed of porccini mushrooms- outstanding.  We ordered the sheep's milk ricotta and Tuscan pecorino cheese ravioli.  These were SUBLIME.  Perfection.  I will never, ever look at ravioli the same way.   The other pasta dish we ordered, the lasagne strips with sea food was equally perfect.   We ordered the chocolate cake with pistachio gelato, which was absolutely delicious.  A great end to a fabulous meal.  We opted to order wines by the glass so that we could taste different things.  We had the falanghina, vermentino, and chainti classico.   They were each lovely.  The service was very good.  We were there almost 3 hours and no one rushed us.  Our primary server was difficult to understand at first because he mumbled, but thankfully he perked up as the evening wore on.  Our other server was a delight from start to finish.  Overall a wonderful dinning experience.  Only draw back is the price.  It is crazy expensive.  Four small plates, 1 dessert, and 4 classes of wine (not the most expensive ones on the wines by the glass list) set my mom back about $250.  That's a lot of money, even if it's for great food.

TlUwLQa6hoAEaHG0WAHbdQ.text: This was the third time I have eaten at Bartolotta. I really have two ratings, a five star for the food and one star for the service. Monday night --not busy, my wife and I were seated at table 43 which is a way out of the way  table with no views of the room even though there were numerous vacant tables the whole time we were there. Was shown the wine list, and the" wine "expert"  showed up fifteen minutes later and we asked for a recommendation on an Italian White. He suggested a wine that he thought very good. Another 15 minutes and he reappeared with a totally different bottle saying he thought it "drier" . We acceded to the change and after thirty minutes we finally had something to go with our bread(very good, by the way). Our waiter went through the menu and made suggestions and we ordered octopus as an appetizer and the sea bass as the entree. After some time a different waiter appeared with my appetizer, dropped it in front of me with a "here you go". The entree was served by yet another waiter who prepared it table side. When our wines glasses were emptied we refilled them ourselves, with no attention from staff. Yet another waiter asked if we wanted desert. Fine food, mediocre, uncaring service, at an expensive restaurant, with an owner of a hotel (WYNN) who cares about his customers and who would be appalled by our service experience.

J8ZoJ6c6OEnV8ClQpHY6MQ.text: Saw this place on  Bizarre Food ( Andrew Z.)  so decided to try it.  There were four of us and we decided to try the Top Chef tasting menu at $180 per person. The shellfish dishes were tremendous, everything was fresh and tasty.  However, the main course of salt baked fish (sea bream?)  was unremarkable and overcooked. This was probably due to the amount of time it took to remove the salt and debone the fish before serving.  The fish would have been better grilled and left to the diners to eat family style, but I guess this is the way it"s done at high end restaurants.  The desserts were plentiful and beautifully presented.   Was it worth $180 per person without wine and cocktails ?   No.

xnCw_tAScehV7qrsiuHPFw.text: Wow, 7 people and reviewer walked away with a tab of $750? How in the world did you do that? Saltines?  I had 4 people and our tab was $600.  That's what happens when you order from their wine list, not cheap.  The food was good, definitely an overwhelming place that fits right into Las Vegas.  Though a very nice and posh experience, I would not spend money here, even expense account money as I had to do on my visit this time.  This is just blowing money out the windows, its classic continental fare prepared to excellence but it has no business costing this amount.

ixdbz6jrf9pgN2i3Uiv8lQ.text: In keeping with the whimsical nature of the Wynn Resort, this two-story restaurant is elegantly designed and decorated, with an open, airy feel and special dining outdoors by "Lake of Dreams" under cabanas and misters.  Service was a bit stuffy, and we weren't really captivated by the long monologue detailing the seafood that was flown in from all the seas of the Italian Mediterranean and which weights were available.  Nor did we want to see the huge platter of the fresh catch flown in that day.  It became very overwhelming for lunch.  My lunch buddy and I ended up simply ordering a pasta dish with tiger prawns and the lobster salad.  Both were tasty, but did not define our expectations of world-class cuisine from the award-winning chef of Spiaggia in Chicago.  Bartolotta is expensive, but I plan to visit again and try more dishes, including the fish.  Maybe it will earn another star once I'm convinced that flying all this fish in daily is worth the cost.  However, I do recommend that you visit it at least once for its atmosphere and beauty; it's like a jewel in the Wynn crown.

IaSmSUKp4fM0jzaGhQsc5Q.text: This place was set in a beautiful location. The service was very good. The food was also very tasty. They specialize in Italian Seafood and had many seafood dishes and fish I had never even heard of that are flown in daily from near Italy. A purple cod? It was intrigued but you needed 2 people in order to get it so I couldn't order it. I had the mushroom, black truffled arugula salad which was very tasty. Followed by the spaghetti with mantis shrimp special appetizer. The desserts weren't bad, either.

photos.caption: Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The outside patio
Photo of Costa di Mare - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fish of the day platter

nbOnivZyZtrObMgX4FfklA.text: Absolutely an experience more than just a meal! I truly can't think of any meal that was as amazing as what we had here.  We enjoyed it so much that we even came back the next night!  Our server was very knowledgeable on everything and you could tell had a passion for the food...ask for Lucciano, trust me that you will be in good, honest hands  I could go on and on about this place but I will keep it brief, but I will say one more thing...  the olive oil they serve with the food is Unbelievable!! I could of drank it out of the bottle  and been beyond content with that alone. The flavor was so clean and refreshing which are not words I would typically use to describe  olive oil. Yummy...  I'm not going to lie, it is the most expensive meal we have ever had but would sacrifice a pair of shoes to do it again!

D-oQSUYOGcL9K0qcbrkc8w.text: Excellent, excellent, excellent. Our waiter was very Italian which added to the already nice ambiance :)  He recommended a great course, the sommelier did a fantastic job picking out a great wine for us to pair with our meal. My party left full and happy, I shall be returning for seconds!

JAec9L5IQnzBiKdjzeT5ag.text: my wife and i went to bartolotta because Bobby Flay recommended them.  Now either B. Flay is on the payroll, or he just has bad taste. The food was horrific. The service was sub-par. The atmosphere was decent. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT, unless you want to spend an exorbitant amount of money. PLEASE listen to me...this food is not good

CIcCeE_mJ3ibs47v1ElDUw.text: In the words of my date, it charmed her pants off.  If you're looking for elegant, white table cloth ambiance for a very romantic evening, then this place is what you're after.  Food was excellent. The gnocchi was amazing, and the fillet was buttery and oh so tender.  Prices aren't cheap, but certainly within reach. Two apps, two entrees, and two drinks, plus tip = $200.

nFMne0AdGrfbjcCG3MOtvw.text: My wife and I ate here on a Sunday evening (3/28/10). We had a 7:15 reservation, and they seated us early.   After looking over the menu, we decided we would go for the Gran Menu di Mare for two ( $155/person)  We both enjoy red wine, but aren't terribly knowledgeable, so I asked the waiter to select one. He asked for a price range, and we had the Il Borro 2006 Super Tuscan ($92), which was very good and complemented the meal well (so much so that we finished it far before we were done eating which is very rare.)
